Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: CinnamonLichfield
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and set by the beach ; Our room was spacious but rather bare - no chairs for example. Good ar conditioning. The bathroom area is well set out and equipped. We were on the ground floor with a private grassed area outside the room and a hammock, two garden chairs and a table. The breakfast is OK but would get a bit monotonous after a few days - other meals were very good. The beach is cleaned and fine although below the water line it is rocky and to swim easily you need to walk up the beach for ten minutes to a sandier area. The real problem is the isolation - it is secluded but surrounded by other properties and the only places to walk are up or down the beach ; taxis into Playa del Carmen cost 170 pesos each way. No children , no TV , wifi access in the bar area. Very nice for a few days but not for much longer. Massage is availabe and many other guests did this although we did not - expensive but they seemed to enjoy it. Pool is small and shallow. Dining room and bar / lounge area are open on three sides but roofed and shaded. Staff pleasant and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Master Suite is a must!”
Reviews.Author: TrinNeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Reve in January (arrived New Year's Day). Because of the holiday and availability, we booked the Horizon Suite for one night before moving to the Master Suite. There was no comparison. The Horizon Suite was lovely, but for a small premium, the Master Suite was exactly what we envisioned for a beach stay. Amazing views, privacy, indoor shower with a view, and a luxurious bed. As for amenities, the gym is very small and not very usable, the pool is nice, but not heated (and could use some updating). If you are in the Master Suite, these minor details are less noticeable. Food was very memorable. Service was also very good - friendly and genuine. It is a small hotel, so we had to wait on occasion for the reception as they give individual attention to each guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate!”
Reviews.Author: HuatulcoHuatulco
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I will celebrate our wedding at Le Reve this summer and after our visit to the hotel last week, we could not be more excited about our decision. We had read a few reviews about the condition of the road leading to Le Reve, so we were a bit worried about this being an issue for our guests. We were relieved to see that it has recently been repaired and we did not have any problems at all driving in. As soon as we arrived at the lobby and caught a glimpse of the beautiful view of the pool, beach and ocean, we knew we had found a little piece of paradise. We were greeted by the lovely Jacqueline from the Concierge team who immediately made us feel welcome, offering us a delicious cocktail before introducing us to our wedding Coordinator, Arlenis. We have been in touch with Arlenis by email and phone over the past few months and she has been amazing with answering all of our questions, sending pictures, making recommendations, and putting us in contact with all of the vendors for our wedding. She will always take the time to help with any question big or small and definitely takes the pressure away from planning a destination wedding. Arlenis gave us a tour of all of the different rooms that our guests will have the option to book (we have reserved all 25 rooms for our group for the wedding weekend so will have the whole place to ourselves!). There are 4 room categories, and each suite is beautifully decorated, with its own unique touches. We loved the hammocks that had just been installed in the garden area of the garden suites and we can definitely picture our guests relaxing in them with a margarita in hand. We then visited the spa area, the gym (small but with all of the essentials), and the spectacular infinity pool before heading down to the beach. We were happy to see that there is a good distance between Le Reve and the hotels on either side so we really felt like it was a private beach. After, we headed to Naay restaurant for our menu tasting and were blown away by the food and service. The Food and Beverage Manager, Antonio, was absolutely incredible and made the experience so much fun! We were so impressed with the food tasting, we can’t even imagine how wonderful the menu will be for the wedding. Antonio explained every dish for us and he and Arlenis were constantly checking-in, taking notes, and asking if we had any special requests. Le Reve really is a spectacular little gem, with a beautiful beach, first class amenities, and above all, incredible service. I would not hesitate for a second to recommend this hotel and cannot wait to celebrate at Le Reve with all of our family and friends this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway near Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: YDL0414
Reviews.Content: We just finished a short relaxing break at the Le Reve- what a beautiful location and hotel! We enjoy small intimate botique hotels and Le Reve did not dissapoint. The view is to die for and the bed was extremely comfortable. It's about 15 min away from Playa del Carmen and is best for vacationers looking for a quiet place, not a loud spring break experience. The water was a bit rocky for our taste, but the hotel provides water shoes that you can borrow, and sandier beaches are a short walk away. The staff is really sweet and helped us book a private car to (don't miss) tulum. Next time we'll book one of the tripadvisor recommended tours for the playa del carmen area, but Le Reve made sure that we didn't miss anything as a result of our last minute planning for our 3 day trip. Worth staying here if you're planning on staying in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lenny G
Reviews.Content: We were wondering if we had gotten lost when the paved road turned into a bumpy dirt road. At the end of the road past all of the mega resorts was La Reve. I love that feeling of getting off the road more traveled, especially when you end up at a great resort with a gorgeous beach. We were lucky enough to stay in one of the bungalows. The room was fantastic and the view amazing. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The beach was very nice and much less crowded than the nearby resorts and the beaches in Playa del Carmen proper. The restaurant does have a Mexican menu available if you ask for it the day before you dine, but the regular menu is very good as well. I am allergic to gluten, and they were able to provide many gluten free items. If you are looking to stay close to Cancun and Playa del Carmen but want to avoid the crowds while you unwind, this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location'! Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Inkimac
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most beautiful hotels! If you love privacy and quiet breezy nights this is the spot for you. The staff was super accommodating and helpful, the pool area was relaxing and our room offered a private yard with hammock and a super soft bed. I cannot think of anything negative to say. I would come back in a heartbeat. Super place for a couples getaway!

Reviews.Title: “A gem at the end of the road! Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: dayan I
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about Le Reve. The entire staff was fantastic! Le Reve’s quality of service was very classy in every way. Jaqueline at the front desk was amazing. We loved her. She helped with advice on what to do & where to go and booking/reservations. She is such a friendly sight that you always want to stop and say hello. She had a way of always putting a smile on our face. The waiters could not have been more welcoming, attentive, friendly, approachable, helpful and low key. Ismael, Roberto,Mario, Ivan, Antonio,Freddy,and Carlos were all great and were a big part of our stay being as memorable as it was. We truly felt comfortable and “at home” because of them. The chef, Medel, is incredible. He could not have been more gracious when we asked to meet him. Everything on the menu is truly delicious. We love to cook at home and also eat out often and found the selection of ingredients in every dish so well placed and thought through. We felt as comfortable dressed casually as we did more formally at dinner. It’s nice to know that you can go there either way. We found ourselves wanting to only eat at the hotel instead of going to town and that says a lot. There are several different types of rooms there. They are all gorgeous, well layed-out and very comfy. My sister & boyfriend stayed at a garden suite and said it was great. We stayed at a master suite and for the first time ever, we ended up staying in a lot, enjoying our big balcony. Jacqueline was nice enough to show us a bungalow with a private pool and it was quite an amazing space as well. A note about past reviews - the road to this hotel is fine! Based on past reviews we were going to rent a Jeep to get us here, but rented a typical car and drove a normal speed down a road that happened to be dirt instead of paved - big deal. The road is a non-issue. All-in-all, if you like comfortable boutique hotels as much as we do, you will love Le Reve! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Dainis K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in bungalow 4 days and had nice rest after partying on cruise ship before. It would be difficult to call this place Hotel& Spa. I would rather call this as a small romantic hotel, as Spa is silly. You can get the same "spa" procedures 50 meters from the hotel near the beach paying 5 time cheaper price. Hotel management have no clue what is " a spa". There was not much need for personal pool near bungalow, as open sea was great. If you have no rubber shoes for swimming, I would recommend a beach about 200 m on the left. This is place with nice sand and water. I believe, the best in this place is a chef. Food is excellent. We have bought lobster from the local fishermen and a chef made excellent risotto with our lobster. Be careful renting a car. Car rental companies with the hotel staff doing their best to make you happy. However, be sure to present when giving car back. We been significantly overcharged for gas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: anna-liisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent several days at Le Reve the week after I took the bar exam and absolutely loved it. It was secluded, quiet, and the staff seem dedicated to pampering the guests. We found it so relaxing that we abandoned all of our plans to go on touristy excursions in favor of naps on the beach, swims in the ocean (1/4 mile up the beach, yes), cocktails in the pool, and nachos and Spanish scrabble at the pool bar. We liked the food so much that we only went into Playa for dinner once. I personally liked the lack of TVs and wifi. If you're looking for a beautiful place to relax, restore, and get away from the grind, Le Reve is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Adult Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: atlabbyj
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic little find in Playa del Carmen. With only 25 (or so) rooms in the entire beachfront hotel, we got first-class service and spent our vacation in a truly tranquil paradise. We stayed in an ocean-view room- Playa Linda- and thought the accommodations were great. The bed was really comfortable and the room was really clean. As many reviews say, many parts of the beach along Playa are "rocky". These are the beautiful reefs that you can explore with snorkel gear. You can also walk about 1/4 a mile north on the beach (you'll pass the all inclusive hotel that has 1000+ hotel guests sitting on top of each other and not be envious at all) and experience a stretch of beach that has no reef at all. The hotel does provide some water shoes, but since it's first come first serve, I recommend bringing a pair. The food is good; we really enjoyed breakfast and lunch. Dinner for us was a miss the one time we ate there-- we may have just ordered the wrong thing. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Location for Our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Jesse-and-Ivana
Reviews.Content: After much searching and discussion, we decided to have a destination wedding in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. As soon as we walked into the LeReve property during our wedding location research we absolutely fell in love with the property and we knew a the decision was made. The place is absolutely incredible, it’s a hidden tropical oasis right on the beach and even though very convenient to get to (45 min from the airport and only 10 minutes by car from Playa Del Carmen) you feel secluded from the tourist crowds. It is a perfect choice if you are looking for a relaxing, sophisticated romantic getaway, or an intimate celebration with close friends and family such as weddings or reunions. The employees were extremely helpful at all times and catered to all of our needs. Our friends and family had so much fun and nothing but good things to say about our choice in the resort. The rooms are spacious, clean and we loved the simple, modern but tropical design. The beach front is conveniently set up so you can either sit by the pool while enjoying the beautiful ocean view or relax on the beach in one of the most comfortable beach beds or hammocks by listening to waves and palm breeze. The food and cocktails were also incredible and the presentation and service were a 5 star quality. And the wedding...the wedding was a dream. The wedding coordinator (Arlenis) followed all of our instructions to a tee (and above) and the decorations and ceremony were breathtaking. We couldn't have asked for a better day. Thank you Arlenis and LeReve for providing our perfect day!

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon couldn't have been better...”
Reviews.Author: pesciolina-amster
Reviews.Content: We got a complementary honeymoon package for our honeymoon in July, 2011. I found this hotel on the internet last winter while I was searching the perfect place for our honeymoon and this place was listed as number one on www.honeymoon.com; after seeing the photos we immediately booked our amazing "bungalow" with this honeymoon package. And the days we spent there were like being in paradise. The hotel is like a secret, like a cave near Playa Del Carmen. Despite of all hustle and bustle of the surrounding hotels, ours was the oasis of tranquility... The best thing is that there were no kids around, running, screaming, jumping in the pool... because the hotel doesn't accept kids below 16 years old, only for special occasions they do this. Our bungalow was awesome, huge and comfortable bed, private garden, private pool in the garden, and just behind our garden there is the ocean.. We slept every night with the sound of waves... Breakfast is perfect, they serve fruits, french toasts, jams, butter and fresh breads, juice, coffee & tea IN ADDITION TO the hot typical and delicious plate which you can choose among 8-9 options. I tried one every morning, all were delicious, for me too much for a breakfast but were delightful. Our honeymoon package had many complementary items like a special dinner on the beach, breakfast at room with sparkling wine, one stone with our names and date, and many other surprises that made us feel the luckiest couple in the world. We were there months ago so maybe I don't remember some details now but overall it was more than great, I don't have the right word to express it. And we really would like to go back there..maybe for an anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ana200
Reviews.Content: I've just arrived from Le Reve and I can tell that is a very good Boutique Hotel to stay! I stayed at bungallow and is amazing. The Staff are very friendly, this hotel is definitly "a secret place to stay". As a secret place, nobody know this hotel, and the road is a really "off road experience", the access is in very bad condition but it is ok, ir is nor a problem, it is part of be a secret place. Special in Paya del Carmen full f big resorts where people should use a ID Bracelet...urg! If you go in a couple, I strongly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “A truly lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: Nicola I
Reviews.Content: Le Reve was exactly as advertised so it was great to arrive to a hotel as incredible as the pictures implied it to be! We stayed in a bungalow called Paraiso... It had a thatched roof so we could hear the ocean in bed and loved going to sleep and waking up to the sound of crashing waves. Every evening we would return to our room, hear the iPod playing and find our canopy and bed turned down with a romantic quote and delicious treat by the pillows. There was no TV in the room which was fantastic as we didn't waste any time watching it! We enjoyed our private pool and dipped in it during the day and evening. From the moment we arrived the service was flawless, all of the staff were extremely welcoming and very helpful. We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and ate every breakfast and lunch there and can happily report that we were spoilt for choice with the restaurant's menu and thoroughly enjoyed each meal! Oh and the drinks too. The cocktails were a real treat especially when they were being served to us on the beach! We went to Fifth Avenue every night for dinner and were impressed with the hotel's recommendations and had fun finding our own spots. The road to the hotel really is a dirt track but all the cab drivers drove slowly to avoid the big bumps and holes. Hopefully it'll get fixed soon! Another honest thing to mention would be a door-less bedroom toilet! The toilet was around a corner so hidden from the bathroom but a door would have been preferred to create some privacy. We had a super time from start to finish and definitely recommend Le Reve to couples looking for a peaceful, relaxing and romantic Mexican beach holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: zeeg
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a lovely time during our stay at Le Reve. The service was impeccable with regard to every aspect during our stay. The food at the restaurant was a pleasant surprise - my bf and I love to enjoy food, and we are quite picky. Every single dish we ate was delicious!! We rented a car and could have gone out for dinner another night, but we chose to eat at the hotel once again. The road is bumpy but it's really not a big deal. Having rented a car (which I recommend if staying here), it was no problem getting out and in to visit other sites around the area. We will definitely return to Le Reve if we return to La Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Time & experience”
Reviews.Author: Patryck V
Reviews.Content: We heard obut this hotel and want to try it, but it exced our expectations, it was amazing all the details the hotel gave us. We had to travel early and they prepared our breackfast at 4:00 am just for the two of us, and sometimes we arrived very late and they attend us excellent. If you want a great experience, calm and peacefull, visit Le Reve!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, amazing people!!”
Reviews.Author: Jill T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Reve for 4 days in December 2011. The hotel was lovely; very peaceful and tranquil. Such a wonderful place to relax and unwind. Obviously you can't beat the location, you're steps away from the gorgeous beach. What really made the trip was the service. Everyone is so friendly and kind, they're never intrusive but they seem to appear out of nowhere when they sense you're in need of something. The Concierge were so helpful, they told us all about the different excursions we could do and made all the arrangements. We both had massages, very relaxing. The food was delicious. My husband is a very picky eater and I was worried he'd hate everything, but he loved the food as well. As to the other reviews, yes the road is bumpy. Really bumpy. We arrived at 11pm and it would've scared me to death if I hadn't already read about it on this site. But it's easy enough to accept and get used to. Yes, the ocean in front of the hotel is rocky. We just wore the complimentary water shoes and were fine. We actually preferred swimming in the ocean to the pool! We were on the bottom floor 3 or 4 rooms in from the end and we didn't hear the generator when we were trying to sleep at all. If you're looking for a party atmosphere, I wouldn't recommend Le Reve. But if you're looking to just unwind and be spoiled, this is the perfect place. You can set the tone of how much or how little you want to do. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Le Reve”
Reviews.Author: Ghost11365
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue - my visit was in March 2011. The reason I decided to post was due to the recent reviews I was reading. The reviews regarding the rocks in the ocean are correct however, as the hotel website explains they have watershoes avialibe. I opted to take a lovely 10 minuiut stroll in either direction along the beach with my fiance (we got enganged at Le Reve - more on this in a few) to a more suitable swimming area. If you would have done your research prior to booking you would have known this was a potential issue. Would I have prefered being able to swim right outside the hotel - yes but I was specifically looking for a boutique hotel so you take the good with the bad (not bad in my opinion). I initally booked the trip so my GF would think we are taking a quick trip to get out of the NYC winter - however the real reason was to propose to my GF. Prior to booking my trip I sent an e-mail to Le Reve asking if the proposal plans I had in mind would be suitable at their hotel, if they had any additional ideas or could assit in my proposal plan. I must have had a least 20 e-mails back-and-forth with the hotel - always with a warm greeting, quick reply and full of great ideas and feedback. I decided to opt for the romatic dinner on the beach which was AMAZING. My GF was blown away. At this point in our trip ALL the employees knew both of our names and room number. For example, after we got engaged and enjoyed our amazing dinner under the stars (with the rest of the guest in awe) we wen to the resturante area and had a bottle of champagine. We ordered a second bottle but decided to take a walk on the beach and I asked if the bottle could be brought to my room - and he said "yes sir i will bring it right away to room..." It was amazing - like the staff was reading my mind. The night we got enganged we went back to our room and the turndown service had an amazing display on our bed - full of roses and towels shaped live swans. Additionally, everynight there are treats (amzing chclcate and pastries) in your room with a wonderful fortuen or words of insight (kind of like a forutne cookie but not corney - very heartfelt). We opted for the car service to and from the airport - both were on time and we were met with a super nice driver who spoke excellent english. The rooms are nice, no TV (but I like hotels with no TV and this is also noted on the hotel website). The hotel does have portable DVD players and being this was noted on the website I brought a few DVDs to watch in the event it rained. All in all it was a great trip, couldn't have been happier - job welldone Le Reve.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff ... shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCHICK48
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Le Reve after a week touring around and living out of suitcases. We were unable to check in as the room was not ready. We were asked if we wanted to wait at the bar and have a welcome cold drink. So far not so bad, had a beer and some lunch, still no room. After three hours we were showed to room 201 which is at the far end of the upper hallway 'Horizon Suites' the room in itself was ok but the location was next to the water filtration plant, no attempt was made to disguise the plant which was very noisey and unattractive. Before we unpacked we complained as we really felt it was unacceptable. Apart from the location the room had so many things wrong with it we rapidly came to the conclusion the room was not in regular use. The duty manager would not admit this, we were offered an upgrade to a bungalow for one night for $100 which we declined, finally we agreed to stay in the room for one night and be moved the following day. The second room 207, was identical to the first but away from the ugly water filtration plant. When we eventually met the manager Gregor he admitted that they only used the room if the hotel was completely full, we were offered a free meal as compensation and also the New Year party which we had been told was included due to an admin error. After the initial teething problems we were quite happy at the hotel, but heard many stories from other guests about being locked out of rooms due to the keys failing etc (a problem experienced by ourselves in the first room, we had to get let in by the duty manager every time we left the room as the key machine had broken down). The best asset this hotel has are it's staff, the restaurant and bar staff were always pleasant and efficient. The food was of a very high standard, delicious and beautifully presented. Nothing more to add to what everyone has said about the road and beach, in my comment form I suggested it might be an idea to build a jetty out over the rocks to allow the guests to get into the sea without fear of injury.

Reviews.Title: “Roberto is Master Margarita Maker”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelBingle
Reviews.Content: My beautiful wife and I stayed at this intimate luxury hotel in the midst of large overpopulated hotels. Le Reve is a diamond in the midst of these congested people clusters. Our Bartender Roberto makes the absolute best Margarita in Playa del Carmen. Gracias Roberto

Reviews.Title: “like manhatton”
Reviews.Author: Julie E
Reviews.Content: the grounds were quite lovely and tranquil, getting to the hotel you really needed a jeep, BEWARE the road is unpaved and full of wholes, if you like hereing a generator all night, like you live in MANHATTON, is unexeceptible. if you are a foodie, you will definately be disappointed, however the food was fine and tasty. the service was good. the weather was perfect. the rooms are very small. and please be sure to swat the mosquitos in your bedroom. i got six HUGE bites. and some of the other guests as well. would i go back... hmmm. if they had a king size bed!!! maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Brandy G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place for a honeymoon if you are looking for quiet, beautiful and personalized service. We felt like pampered celebrities! We stayed in a Bungalow which had its own deck with dive pool and then led out to the soft sand and then to the ocean. The room was amazing, the air conditioner kept the room cool and the humidity out. The restaurant was magnificent, breakfast was our favorite and it was included in the price of the Honeymoon upgrade--meaning it was free! We even had our own romantic dinner set up for us on the beach! It was beautiful, sitting there by the ocean, listening to the waves, eating our steaks...this hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was very friendly and tremendously helpful, we would just tell them what we wanted to do and they would have it all arranged. The road leading to the hotel is bumpy and I was expecting it after reading other reviews, they drivers drive super slow on it so it is not uncomfortable and you are on it less than 5minutes. We are hoping to go back soon. Its a lovely place. the restaurant bar makes AMAZING margaritas...I probably had 27 of them!

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful resort to escape too”
Reviews.Author: Johnna W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Le Reve in October for our honeymoon. The staff is so warm and accomodating. They really made our stay so perfect. All of our meals we had at the restaurant were incredible. My husband caught a fish one day and they even prepared it for us. It was delicious. We felt spoiled the whole time we were there. We stayed in a bungalow suite our last night whch was fabulous. The pool is really nice too. The only downfall is there a reef right in front of the hotel so when you walk into the water, it is a bit rocky. But they do provide water shoes for you to wear. We can't wait to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing - Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: We started the first leg of our 14 day Honeymoon here and the only bad thing about it, was that we eventually had to leave. We spent the first 4 days in a Beach Bungalow and we had such an amazing time. From the moment we arrived we received personalized and attentive service like we've never experienced before. We even showed up way early and they worked so hard to make sure our room was ready for us. First and foremost, it's small, intimate and very romantic. If you're looking for a huge all-inclusive resort with tons of screaming Americans, this isn't the place. You turn off of Federal Highway 307 and drive through some greenery for a few minutes. You then take one of the bumpiest roads in all of Mexico for about a mile or so, only to end up at the small, boutique-style, paradise with a small open air lobby overlooking the beautiful water. I noticed alot of people on here took the bumpy road as a negative for this place, but it's municipal land, and the hotel has no say in getting it fixed, so they have no control over it. Second, the food was fantastic. I read some reviews that said it wasn't too good, but ours was fresh, authentic and our waiter service was wonderful. We dealt alot of Ishmael, who took very good care of us throughout our stay not only in the restaurant, but when bringing things to our room and getting us drinks while on the beach. The restaurant overlooks the Caribbean and we loved it. Third, our service was so personal, we felt like at the end of the stay, we knew everyone. They called us by our names all week, the personal touches they paid attention to in terms of our turn down service and little gifts and desserts they'd deliver each night, made it such a wonderful experience. Fourth, if you are on the fence about room choice and can pay a little more, the Beach Bungalows are amazing, so spend the money and get one. We stayed in the bungalow suite named Boca Del Cielo. The king size bed was so comfortable, the bathroom and shower were fantastic. At night when we went to sleep, we'd leave the bathroom light on just near the toilet section and when we'd lay in bed and stare up, the ceiling looked awesome since it's a pitched straw roof. Absolutely awesome view. Other than that, we'd swim in our private plunge pool during the day, sit out on our private deck at night, and fall asleep to the sound of the wave crashing only 30-40 feet from our door. In the morning we'd open the shades and lay in bed and have a perfect view of the sea. Absolutely great. There is no TV in the room, and as someone who watches TV every night before they go to bed, my wife and I didn't mind it at all. Finally, the beach is rocky, Yes. But they don't tell you to bring water shoes or anything like that because they provide that all for you. As soon as you walk down to the beach there is a whole rack with water shoes, snorkel gear, all that stuff. Don't let the reviews citing the beach is too rock-ey scare you. Also, we highly recommend the cab ride to downtown Playa del Carmen. Very safe, tons of shops and restaurants, and just a really good way to immerse yourself in the culture. only about a 15 minute ride. All in all, this place was flat out amazing. They've received multiple awards and recognition, as well as a Conde Nast Recommended places award. We got the Honeymoon package and the private Dinner on the beach was perfect and all of the small details made the trip that much more enjoyable. We will definitely be going back here. We've never been more relaxed in our lives. Please don't hesitate to contact me directly with any questions or info about it. We'd love to spread their name and great service any way possible. .

Reviews.Title: “You only know when you get there”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT G
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most relaxing hotels we have ever stayed in and we've been married and touring for 47 years so we've seen quite a few. It's beautiful, clean, food is excellent and not outrageously priced and we found the service faultless.There are one or two things to be wary of before booking. The road; it is unmade and very bumpy for the last 1/2 mile and it is about a 10 to 15 minute drive to the main road and access to other towns etc. if you ever decided to go anywhere, we didn't. Your tour operator will tell you the road is under construction,it isn't. The hotel is not connected to a mains electricity supply so the hotel operates a very noisy generator 24/7 which is a problem if you are a light sleeper. If you have children aged beween 3 and 10 be warned that the very attractively styled stairways and balconies are potentially very dangerous, and would almost certainly not be allowed under UK building regs.Wheelchair users would have regular difficulties Either side of the hotel are large vacant sites, one has some buildings on it but is now for sale and the other is scrubland. Check very carefully with your agent about what is happening to these sites before you book. This real gem of an hotel could be ruined by the building of "disco all hours" hotels on either side.One last tip; whatever anyone tells you there are mosquitos, take some spray and relax,that's what this hotel is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Secluded Paradise”
Reviews.Author: fg1186
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Le Reve after spending four nights there, and I miss it already! The hotel is beautiful, it's simple and tastefully decorated. I was a bit anxious after reading about all the reviews that included people hating the long dirt road to the hotel, which is true-the road is bumpy and it takes forever to get there via a taxi. The plus side is, once you're there you never want to leave! We wanted to take tours and visit Coba and Rio Secreto, but none of the tours would pick us up at the hotel because of the road. The solution that we found is to be picked up at Azul Five which is located next to Le Reve. Rather than walking down the dirt road to the hotel, we walked on the beach and through the back end of Azul Five without any issues at all! The food was delicious, and although we never only eat at our hotel, we didn't want to leave and try the mostly sub-par food in Playa del Carmen. Although the beach is rocky, if you walk 10 minutes in either direction there is beautiful turquoise water without rocks to swim in. When you see the huge resorts blasting trashy music you'll be so thankful that you stayed at Le Reve. As other reviews have mentioned, Le Reve is really a romantic place to come with your partner, although you could stay there with friends it's really geared towards couples and everyone seems to be on their honeymoon. If you want peace, quiet, amazing service, and beautiful surroundings Le Reve is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing couples getaway!”
Reviews.Author: aboutagirltoo
Reviews.Content: So serene, great staff, beautiful spaces. Very tranquil and relaxing! Everything is aesthetically pleasing — great design, layout, furniture, hammocks. We stayed in a second floor Horizon Suite room and it was lovely. The individual huts down below looked amazing with walk out to the beach and private mini-pool. We walked the beach down to Playa (about 1 hour to get there) which is fun, saw all the other places along the way. Loved ours! The beach is definitely rocky, so if you want to regularly get in the Caribbean (if the pool won't do) then you might not want to stay here. That road is bumpy, but we just laughed about it. The ceviche here is amazing too!

Reviews.Title: “Le Reve = Where Heaven Kisses Earth!”
Reviews.Author: RedIbyChelseaJewelry
Reviews.Content: I've traveled the world and stayed in so many different hotels and resorts. This hotel has blown all of the others away. We arrived at Le Reve after our trash the dress and jewelry photo shoot in a cenote. We planned on the second half of our photo shoot at sunrise on the beach and pool at the hotel the next morning. Immediately upon stepping into the stunning open air lobby, I knew we were in for a treat. Refreshing glasses of iced tea were brought to us as we breezed through check-in. On the wall in the lobby there is a plaque that indicates it is one of the top 100 Sexiest hotels...for good reason. Dramatic steps (perfect for a wedding) lead down to the zig zag sleek infinity pool with a straight view to the sapphire ocean. Onto the details: ROOM: We were taken to our room and our jaws dropped. It was a modern design with sparkling white floors, a huge vanity area and separate glass shower. A large closet was available to hang our clothes and a safe for checking valuables. Further in was a beautiful bedroom (which happened to have rose petals, wine, fruit and swan towels (we indicated we were there celebrating my birthday and belated anniversary). Rose petals were even sprinkled in a towel design by the glass shower. The most impressive feature were the floor to ceiling windows which looked out perfectly over the infinity pool and ocean (talk about an absolutely incredible sunset/sunrise opportunity!). The door was easily opened to the patio where wooden recliner chairs and a table were placed perfectly to enjoy our bottle of wine as the sun set. SERVICE: From the staff at check-in to everyone else that we encountered, everyone truly seemed to love their jobs. There really wasn't anything that you could request that couldn't be fulfilled. The waitstaff was so friendly and even when we requested another bottle of wine to have on another night, it was quickly brought up to our room and opened on our balcony. Each evening a little treat with a sweet note was brought. It's those special details that make a boutique hotel even more charming. FOOD: Amazing! The breakfast was included and very good. We tried a few different dishes from the club, hamburger, nachos, guacamole, and chicken parm for lunches and all were great. They also had 10-12 different ceviche dishes at lunch time that we definitely want to experience next time. Each evening we tried something different from the Duck, warm octopus salad, orange chicken, Tampiquena and various sides. We were never disappointed. We typically stay at larger hotels but heard so many great things about Le Reve. We had our sunrise trash the dress session on the beach and at the pool. Even with the hotel being full, we still had so much privacy and we never felt like we were on top of anyone. There were always plenty of lounge chairs both at the pool and on the beach. A wedding had been there the day before we arrived so there were still guests (but again, it never felt crowded at all). With the attention to detail and super romantic vibe of the hotel, I can only imagine how amazing it would be to have a wedding there. It's a hidden gem in the hungle with a fabulous stretch of beach perfect to celebrate...anything! This completely changes my mind about a boutique hotel. I was just about kicking and screaming when we left yesterday!

Reviews.Title: “We liked LeReve”
Reviews.Author: slckiwi
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 4 day stay at the Le Reve! We knew about the quirks (rocky beach below the water-line) and the rough road - so were not surprised by this. The sand on the beach where you relax was super soft and we did not bother with shoes on our walks up and down the beach. The room was comfortable and clean and we loved not having a tv. The restaurant was reasonably priced and the food was awesome. We liked it being adults only, and we found the staff attentive but not overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Le Reve!”
Reviews.Author: MrBartholetti
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in january 2011. Some reasons for not staying here: 1 kilometer dark bumpy road to get to the hotel from the main road between cancun and playa. took about 10 minutes to drive that kilometer. annoying when traveling back and forth the playa centrum beacuse the food was not impressive in the hotel. the quality of the building truly sucks in many ways. the shower, the balcony etc. the room was very humid when we stayed there beacuse the wind from the ocean went right tru the balcony doors so much that our clothes became damp and did smell bad beacuse of it. we changed to a suite but same problem but beacuse of the roof was made of some kind of hay. The beach was also a dissapointment beacuse you need to have shoes on when you enter the water. it was full of rocks on the bottom. i didnt see that in the pictures!!! The staff was not very nice some of them rude except for Jesus. He did his best! Thanks for that!! We changed hotel after four nights we should have stayed 10. We changed to Hotel Basico in playa center! We saved 1,5 hour in taxi trips each day and the beach was great just one block from the hotel and you didnt need shoes to take a dive into the ocean!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Reve for 7 nights in October and absolutely loved it. We stayed in one of the Master Suites, "Troncones", and I highly recommend this room. First of all, the view is unbeatable. As soon as you walk into the room, all you see is beauty. The king size bed has four posts and a pretty white net all around it. The entire wall on the beach side is glass with sliding doors, and overlooks the gorgeous infinity pool and pristine beach and ocean. The bathroom has a rainshower with wood floor, so lovely. The entire hotel is comprised of only 25 rooms and we NEVER felt crowded at the pool, beach or restaurant. The hotel provides huge beach towels, shoes for going in the ocean and snorkeling gear if you're interested and the ocean water is so nice to swim in. The pool is very clean and cold--this was very refreshing. The restaurant is top notch and offers a great selection of gourmet food. The staff is very friendly and accomodating and will bring food and drinks to the beach, pool, outdoor lobby area or your room if you'd like. We had breakfast on our second floor deck one morning and it was breathtaking. One thing to keep in mind--it is a place for relaxing and soaking up the sun, not for a crazy party. Some nights all we wanted was quiet so we stayed in but other nights we wanted more of a scene so took the 15 min cab ride to downtown Playa. We also walked left up the beach to some of the other resorts for a drink just to explore. Overall, I wouldn't change a thing. This was exactly what we needed after a crazy wedding weekend. Don't be discouraged by the road leading to the hotel--it's full of pot holes and seems to lead nowhere, then you arrive in paradise. PS, if you want to go riding while in town, go to Rancho Baaxal. Excellent, well taken care of horses.

Reviews.Title: “a dream place”
Reviews.Author: CLBPARIS251
Reviews.Content: this place is really beautiful and peacefull; a bit far away from the center of playa del carmen which is perfect to have a relax and calm stay; rooms are very nice, cleand and with full comforts and amenities; staff is kind, service is very good; food is also great, so no need to go to the twon center to find a restaurant which are moreover mostly all bad; the swimmingpool overlooking the amazing caribbean sea is superb; and if you really want a dream stay, book the bungalow with private pool.... definitively a place to stay for a lover stay.

Reviews.Title: “I don't think I'd go back...”
Reviews.Author: pamhDurhamNC
Reviews.Content: First of all the good- the vibe and the staff were lovely! Couldn't have been more pleasant ... we loved them! The vibe manages to be hip-chic-spa...super, including the pre loaded ipods in the room! the pool is BEAUTIFUL... the massage I got was great!!! The reasons we wouldn't go back? Well we had a beach front plunge pool suite and were eaten with mosquioes... including inside the room after spraying inside and outside with home and garden 24 hr repellent, because there's standing water draining from the plunge pool and LARGE gaps (like finally stuffed toilet paper in them) in the window sills. This means a plunge pool is unuseable at night.We seriously decided that the garden rooms or the new 'spa' suites would be the way to go- because there was no way for us to sit out at the plunge pool at night... The food is good, but very expensive and you are asked not to bring in outside food or drink .. The pool chairs are really!!!! close together...shade is hard to come by...on a day where the beach isn't great it gets crowded fast...and the beach isn't a swimming sandy beach Finally, the gardener who started watering from the hook up next to our plunge pool at about 6:15 in the morning... coudn't sleep through it... seriously, he hooked up within 20 feet of the foot of our bed... so couldn't skinny dip, leave curtains open for sunrise, etc... I think the difference between everyone loving it and our review may have been the room- it had so much potential for a romantic stay, but the small things really eroded our initially positive view.. Hints? Don't get a plunge pool.... and it really does look ike the pictures!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best, most fabulous place ever!”
Reviews.Author: heyliz
Reviews.Content: We never left the hotel... there was no reason to. No food could have been more delicious, no setting more beautiful, no service could have been more attentive. We were there for our 2nd anniversary, and it was incredibly romantic. The private dinner on the beach was amazing. I actually fought back tears upon leaving! We will be back!!! I have been searching for a recipe to make the stuffed poblano peppers, they were fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: CaioAb
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip with my girlfriend with 4 days at Le Reve and could not be more happy of the choice. The room was very comfortable, we had a Garden Suite, the room was spacious, clean and cozy, and the garden was nice! access to the beach was a few steps away and we could leave through the garden On day one tried to get the suite's jacuzzi working, which is outside, but it would not fill. We told the reception and maintenance guys repaired it very quickly :) Breakfast is amazing, personnel was very efficient smiley and helpful Really, being very honest this hotel exceeded all my expectations Little recommendation, if you are planning to go to the city center frequently or visit the some archeological sites, it is really recommended to rent a car! Taking cabs each time can be expensive! Really great to be on this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: legend15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon at the Le Reve hotel and we would recommend this to anyone looking to get away on a romantic and relaxing trip! The pictures on the hotel website are exactly what this hotel looks like and nothing is better than looking out your hotel window and seeing their beautiful pool with the Caribbean ocean behind it. This is the most relaxing place we have ever been and we never got tired of laying by the pool and the ocean. The service is incredible and we just had to think of wanting something and someone was there. Also, the two chefs at the hotel restaurant were amazing and it was some of the best meals we had on the whole trip. If you are looking for a place to honeymoon, the complimentary honeymoon package can't be beat. All of the staff went out of their way to make this trip special and they provided us with a dinner on the beach, matching bathrobes with our names, a commemorative stone on the property, champagne in our room, transportation from the airport, complimentary breakfast each day and much more. The hotel is beautiful and Playa del Carmen has tons of things to do and we are already planning our return trip for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GG33nyc
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place for a quiet and relaxing vacation. The hotel is simple and beautiful, the pool area is so picturesque and the beach is secluded and gorgeous (although there are big rocks at the entrance to the water which make it difficult to get into the water, but you can just walk a bit to the left or right and it's fine). The staff were all so sweet and attentive and the food was great! I definitey hope to return...

Reviews.Title: “Who cares about the road? This was a wonderful place to stay!"”
Reviews.Author: kyuskoff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 6 days at Le Reve. We got in just before a wedding party bought out the hotel (more on that later). We stayed in a garden room which is one of their smaller rooms but we never felt cramped. The one thing I wished we had was a chair. The only thing to sit on besides the bed was a bench at the end of the bed and the lounge chairs outside. However, if this was important enough to me to request I'm positive they would have accommodated me. When we turned off the highway we noticed the road deteriorated. There is about 5 minutes of bumpy dirt road that makes you think, "What did I get myself into?" When you reach the hotel all of our doubts evaporated. We were greeted in the open air lobby and while we were checking in we were served fresh juice. The service was excellent. The price of the food in about the same in town if you go to any of the nicer eating establishments. The quality of the food was ALWAYS good. I thought the cost of the water was a little steep but if you consider that everything needs to be hauled into the Cancun area this is understandable. On the third day my wife and I figured out that it was going to get expensive buy lunch and dinner everyday so we went into town and took a trip to the grocery store. We bough some lunch items to keep in our room so we could eat a mid-day snack and save about $30 a day on food. Remember pick up Ziplock bags and containers and clean up after yourself if you eat in the room. This is a tropical environment, people, and there ARE going to be bugs! We had some leftover bananas at the end of our stay and we took them to be bar and they made a wonderful rum drink for us. Since we supplied the fruit they only charged us for the booze (about half price)! On our last night we were the only couple left that was not part of a wedding party. Not wanting us to feel left out the staff set up a private table pool side and served us a special meal (Thank you Antonio). We did not want to go home from our stay. The hotel was so nice and the staff so warm it felt like leaving family behind. This place is definitely going to see us again! On a side note, my wife does an online cooking show. On our last day was asked if we could interview the head chef. He agreed to come out and do a demonstration on how to make ceviche which my vegetarian wife LOVED! Then they took us into the kitchen and allowed us to film how they make their lime soup (delicious by the way). Having seen behind the curtain I can say that their food prep areas are impeccably clean. Anyone we spoke to who got "sick" were positive that they picked it up in town. I'd like to thank the management and staff at Le Reve for taking such good care of us and giving us access that would normally be refused anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jdski07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon and would highly reccommend Le Reve to any couple looking for a relaxing, romantic adventure together. We stayed in a bungalow suite: the view was perfect (uninterrupted ocean), the room was romantic (nightly turn down service and lots of beautiful lighting). What will keep us coming back: The Service: Was excellent. Very attentive staff at the pool bar and restaurant, would respond to requests, very kind and personable. Tips are included in food and drink, but we felt very comfortable tipping more. Great concierge that would plan activities and set us up for wonderful adventures. The View: Seriously, it's perfect. The Pool/Beach: Cleaned every day, plenty of places to lay, hammocks, can order a drink every-where. The Food: Very good, good variety, we reccommend dinner on the beach (amazing), and the tacos from the pool side lunch menu. What we didn't love: -No door on the bathroom in the suite, it is tucked in a private corner -The internet signal was not strong in the suites by the beach (but of course, who really needs internet when you are 30 feet from the ocean)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a wedding and holidays”
Reviews.Author: 2MIMI3
Reviews.Content: Our friends selected this hotel for their wedding and we decided to make it our holiday destination. From day one the staff was ultra-friendly and did everything possible to make us feel welcome. Prior to arrival we informed them that our flight was 12 hours late and hence we would arrive in the early morning (2am), and they left some sandwiches in our room and were even kinder to warm them up at that hour making us forget all troubles with the airline. The hotel is very simple but very elegant. It’s not child friendly so makes it ideal for couples and honeymooners. We went to other hotels nearby and this was by far the best one based on excellent food, friendly staff and secluded location. They were also amazing and very accommodating to the bride and groom requests and the wedding was a wonderful and very happy day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tibiciman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at Le Reve and we loved it. It is both small and cozy, but also classy and stylish. The stuff was really helpful, especially people at the front desk who very accurately explained how to get around, what to see etc. The rest of the stuff was friendly and did their best to make our stay there very pleasant. The choice of food was not that big, but we absolutely enjoyed everything we tried at the hotel. The breakfast was very filling (with pastries, fruit, toast and a dish of your choice). The ambiance at the restaurant was nice, with great lounge musing playing in the background. One nice thing was that they would leave a small 'surprise' desert on the bed every evening. The beach is nice and, although the rocks make it a little difficult to swim in the ocean, the pool that is right on the beach is an excellent substitute (plus the bar is also right there). Overall we liked our stay at Le Reve. Of course there things that could be improved (such as placing a more visible sign on the main road, having a paved road instead of a true off road experience or having just 1-2 additional pieces of furniture so that the bed is not the only thing that you can sit on), but all these things fade relative to the nice things the hotel has to offer. We would definitely recommend this plays to everyone looking to spend a couple of days in a nice place, away from the TV and loud tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Le Reve is perfect for a romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jshafritz
Reviews.Content: We loved Le Reve! The pool is beautiful and right on the beach. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. The food is pretty good and they offer free breakfast each morning. We just visited for 3 nights on our honeymoon and had a really relaxing stay! Full disclosure: There was not a door on the bathroom in our room, so just be prepared to have an intimate vacation! We stayed in a bungalow with our own little pool right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “simple boutique stay”
Reviews.Author: chizzoy
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a destination wedding. the couple booked the whole place out. they really were serviced well. it was fun and it was like we owned the whole grounds. plus- 1) Food! i was pleasantly surprised. 2)Service - the staff are the nicest locals 3) Pride - this hotel wants to ensure you have a pleasant experience. Negatives - if you get caught in a storm, make sure you bring something to entertain yourself. not much around here because it's a very seclusive location. but if youre here to come and relax, great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Best Destination Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Breannamacchia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at Le Reve last month and it was flawless. When looking at resorts in Mexico, we wanted something that would be intimate while still luxurious and beautiful. Le Reve was the perfect fit. We had 71 people attend the wedding. 50 guests stayed at Le Reve and the remaining stayed at Sandos, which was a short walk down the beach. Since we had reserved the entire resort for the weekend it felt like we had our own private oasis. It was such an incredible gift to stay in a resort with all of our friends and families. This allowed everyone to spend time together before the wedding and really enjoy each other’s company. We worked with Arlenis and Marianna, the in house wedding coordinators and they were fabulous. They made sure that every detail was perfect and went above and beyond their job responsibilities to make sure our entire group was happy. I plan events for a living; so needless to say, I have an eye for detail. They executed all of events beautifully - Rehearsal dinner, ceremony, reception and farewell brunch. The food is delectable; the entire staff is welcoming, friendly, and accommodating. The property is pristine. Le Reve is truly a piece of paradise and we were lucky to have found such a perfect location for our wedding. Le Reve completely exceeded our expectations and I would recommend this resort to anyone looking to have their dream destination wedding. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, modern getaway perfect for couples”
Reviews.Author: echo366
Reviews.Content: My now fiancé and I love LOVE it here. To the point that we are considering it as our venue and lodging for our upcoming wedding. The service is phenomenal. The view is gorgeous. I enjoy the breakfast that is complimentary to many packages. The decor is very modern without being cheesy. I think the prices are fair but we always try to get a good deal, whether it's through a website sale or asking for ongoing specials. My favorite thing to do there is just RELAX. So you know my raves. The minor drawbacks is that there is a very dusty, bumpy road leading to the hotel. The beach that is directly in front or back of the hotel is a little rocky underwater. You would need water shoes. But the sandy part of the beach is very nice and quiet. And if you're really up for a swim, there are lots of options for that a quick 3 minute walk over. It is an adults only hotel so that could limit you from bringing everyone for a family get together. And that's part of how Le Reve maintains the environment it does. If you have older kids, you can ask them about it. We love Le Reve. We have been there twice and think it will always be our little haven.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: blinkGi
Reviews.Content: We found Le Reve through ideeli and read all the reviews here at tripadvisor. While the hotel is not located in downtown Playa, we had an amazing experience. It was exactly we were looking for. Le Reve offers perfect service, gorgeous architecture, quiet and comfortable rooms, fabulous beach. We enjoyed a lot their margaritas (get Mario to prepare you some: he rocks!), the massage by the beach (Nora is incredible!), the food (delicious!) and the peaceful view of the pool. Most of the guests at the hotel were couples and they seem to do a great job on hosting weddings. We got a chance to visit Tulum, Cozumel and went few times to downtown Playa (about 15min cab ride, $17). We will definitely come back when in Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Mini Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jutah31
Reviews.Content: My then fiancee and I choose this place since it seemed like a good combination of an intimate resort but close to Playa for shopping or going out, and it really turned out to be a perfect balance. We had the paradise suite and it was awesome. Private pool and great view of the water and beach as well. Had some very good food and drinks from the pool bar and the restaurant while there. The bar didn't offer a certain type of beer that we had asked about and the next day one of the staffers had gone out and picked up a six pack to stock the bar for us. It was a very nice above and beyond type of move and we appreciated it. The two women at the front desk we interacted with the most were both very helpful and knowledgeable. One of the two recommended an all inclusive golf outing at Playacar that was awesome and a highlight of the trip. On the negative side I got a massage at there open air platform above the pool bar and while a bit apprehensive about the location ended up not minding at all being so out in the open. More so it was the quality of the massage--I felt it was too strong and thought the male massage therapist wasn't as good as other massages I've had. There was also very loud music coming from a beach bar the resort to the south on two of the nights. I walked around a bit and think it was only certain spots on the property where this noise was very loud, so it wasn't likely affecting most people, but it was pretty loud for us. Overall, the resort really had a beautiful look and feel, never felt crowded although it was full while we there, had friendly staff and a nice big beach out in front and beautiful Caribbean views. We also went out in Playa a couple times and were recommended a terrific restaurant in a cave off the strip by the Front Desk and stumbled upon an asian fusion place on the main strip and both dinners off property were great. In the end we were really glad with our decision and it was a great break and place to celebrate our recent wedding.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect destination Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia-m-gifford
Reviews.Content: Le Reve was absolutely the perfect destination for my son and daughter in law's wedding in late May. We stayed 7 days, booked the entire hotel for 3 days and had the most amazing time with 72 family and friends. The photos does not completely show how spacious and beautiful the hotel and surroundings are. You feel like you are in a quiet oasis with nothing else around, although there are other hotels close by on the beach, so it feels very safe. Most of our friends and family stayed at Le Reve, with the overflow of guests staying at Sandos Caracol. These hotels were approx 15 min. car drive a apart, but only a 3-5 minute walk on the beach. This made it very easy for our guests to go back and forth for the wedding events. We have never stayed at a hotel in which the entire staff was so accomodating and wonderful. We miss them already! Arlenis and Mariana were the most amazing coordinators of our wedding and took care of every detail and were always available at a moments notice. They even thought of the details that we did not think of. The beauty of the ceremony on the beach, the rehearsal dinner on the beach, and the brunch after the wedding in the open air dining area was so much more than I had expected. The food at all of the events, breakfast every morning was perfect. We ate dinner at Le Reve every night except on night, and most lunches. The pool was perfect and there is a lot of shade around the pool. Although we stayed in the Master Suite, all rooms are wonderful and all arranged slightly different. We all asked for the brand of the mattress...most comfortable ever! We cannot wait to return to Le Reve and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a destination wedding, or just a quite get a way for a special celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: jorgehenriquez
Reviews.Content: An unbelievable stay!!! This is my second time at the hotel and I am in love with it. It is just the right size in just the right place and all for what amounts to a steal!! I spent the weekend there and had a fabulous time. The rooms are pristine, I stayed din a suit in-front of the ocean. If you feel the need you can go commando at night!!! and its heaven. Mexico has some of the best service in the world and the hotels lives up to that reputation. The people are kind and extremely attentive! the service was just spectacular. Now this place has an architecture to die for. The sense pf arrival the two walls framing the pool and ocean and the Palapa roof all come together to create Paradise recovered! Loved it Jorge H

Reviews.Title: “JUST what we were looking for...”
Reviews.Author: KittyHemlock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a trip to Le Reve to celebrate our 10th Anniversary. We had a fantastic time at Le Reve and would highly recommend it for those seeking relaxation in a beautiful location with excellent service. Our transfer to and from the Cancun airport was seamless. Our driver, Henry, was great. His SUV was comfortable and he was punctual, professional, and happy to answer our questions about the area. We stayed in a Garden Room. The room was well designed and modern with a minimal amount of furnishings. The bed was cozy. The room would definitely benefit from a small table and chair(s) and some type of iPod dock for music, certainly not necessities, but would be nice. The view from this room is just so-so. Not bad, you just look at the back of the ocean front bungalows. We loved the food. Breakfast was fantastic. We were not disappointed in the selection like some other reviewers have mentioned. I do think that some of the lunch offerings were a bit overpriced. We were the first to order from the new Mayan menu and it was quite tasty. Each night the chef would prepare an amuse bouche and it was always amazing. Also delicious were the treats left in the room at turndown service. Nice touch. The bite of Tres Leches cake was something particularly special. The property is well-maintained and offers spectacular, do-nothing-but-stare-at-the-water-all-day views. The gym is certainly not a strong suit of the hotel. While the view is beautiful, the ventilation was poor. Therefore, exercise was hard to maintain for any extended period of time without being smoking hot. My husband and I had relaxation massages at the spa that were very nice. I also had an Organic facial. The massages were great, the facial just ok. The sun was blazing in my eyes during the facial so it wasn’t the most relaxing. Our massages also started an hour late and although I asked, no one seemed to acknowledge it or provide an explanation. I attributed the lack of communication to the language barrier. Did I just complain about my spa day in paradise? My apologies. The clientele of the hotel while we were there was mostly young professionals. While we made some friends, for the most part people were quiet and kept to themselves. One of the biggest strengths of this hotel is the people. The hotel manager has done a great job of staffing the property with genuinely nice and accommodating people and it shows. We look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A dream! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: traveler2024
Reviews.Content: If you can, enjoy or upgrade to a bungalow ...breakfast outstanding ..ambience ...peaceful serene....walk to Playa del Carmen. Downtown. An hour away down the coast ..a gem of a property ..cons...wifi. weak...unavailable sometimes...great pickup/dropoff set up online..do it...

Reviews.Title: “This place is the best kept secret on the Riviera Maya!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mwilliams3501
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recenty returned from our honeymoon at Le Reve and both agree that our trip could not have been better. Everywhere you look, there's another postcard. Also the staff were more than helpful in arranging trips, etc. The food was absolutely wonderful! I would recommend this to anyone! as I said before, this is the best kept secret on the riviera maya.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelfishsf
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from my 5 night stay at Le Reve for a wedding it's best to share my experience while I'm still depressed about being back home in San Francisco. As I've attended many, many weddings in various locations around the world over the last 20+ years I can honestly say the Le Reve without a doubt tops my list. From the charm of the hotel (no tv's or clocks to be found anywhere) to the courteous and friendly staff you cannot beat this place. There are 25 rooms which were all rented out by the wedding party so essentially for the 5 days it became our home. The great part about taking over the hotel is I did not know too many people attending the wedding but by the end of my stay I not only had a chance to chat with most of the people but could not help but really get to know everyone and share some great stories, laughs, etc. The staff was great! Extremely friendly, attentive to everyone's needs but not overbearing. A couple of items to note to avoid any disappointment. I stayed in a Horizon Suite which was very nice but if you're expecting a full ocean view you might want to double check which room you're staying in because there are definitely partial views. The other downside was the lack of sand in the ocean directly in front of the hotel. It is almost all coral and wearing some protective shoes is a must if you go swimming or snorkeling. Now you can walk a couple hundred yards down the beach and find a sandy spot to swim in the ocean. However, you will not find a nicer, more relaxing pool with an incredible view than at the Le Reve. The rehearsal dinner, wedding and reception were all held on the beach and the backdrop could not have been nicer. I normally take these things for granted having never been married myself but to watch how hard Arlenis and Mariana worked to make sure everyone was happy and having a good time while getting their work done was downright incredible. These ladies always had an upbeat and friendly attitude while probably being stressed out from time to time but you would never had known it. Everything was always very well organized with amazing attention to detail from the table settings to the layout of the wedding itself. The bottom line is if you want a relaxing, quaint and memorable place to have a wedding or vacation where the staff makes you feel welcome and spoiled Le Reve is definitely the place. I'll definitely be back...sooner than later hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect escape to get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: leedeedav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Le Reve in April '11. We were longing to get away from daily routines, kiddos, and work, and we were able to do exactly that at Le Reve. The name really does say it all-- upon entering the hotel and walking around the gorgeous (and beautifully manicured) grounds, it feels dreamlike. The driveway-- I get why other reviewers had complaints about this, but my husband and I completely agree that the approach takes you off the beaten path and reminds you that you are away from all the tourism of the area...the hotel is so peacefully secluded. Upon arriving, we were brought delicious iced tea with lime while checking in-- delicious! The rooms--For the first two nights, we stayed in a Garden Suite as the Master Suite was unavailable until our third day. The Garden Suite was very nice, although somewhat small for our taste. There was easy access to the pool and grounds from the Garden Suite. We had the first suite near the pool, and on one occasion, we could hear a loud girl (a guest) at the pool and dishes in the kitchen while we were trying to nap-- this was definitely not routine though. Now, for the Master Suite- if you are trying to make a decision between rooms, the Master is AMAZING!!! It was so roomy with high thatched ceilings, gorgeous blowing curtains, a huge private balcony, and the shower in our suite overlooked the ocean and grounds (not to mention it was huge!). The Bungalows were not in our budget, so I can't speak to those, but the Master Suite may even be a better option with it's gorgeous view from the top of the hotel, plus you feel especially secluded from the other guests. The service-- Perfect. I agree with other reviewers that it was just enough-- not checking on you every minute, yet not keeping you waiting. All staff were very cordial and professional. We especially thank Roberto, Freddy (who carried an enormous & heavy breakfast in bed all the way up to our suite one morning), Jacqueline, and also the hotel manager-- but we never got his name unfortunately. They really went out of their way to make sure we were happy, and they very much succeeded. The restaurant-- Breakfast was AMAZING, the kind that makes you not want to get in your bathing suite afterwards... but we were on vacation! After eating that breakfast, we were good to go until dinner. We ate at the restaurant for dinner most nights and enjoyed the food. There were so many layers of flavor in the dishes-- loved them. I would like to see even more local/ traditional entree options on the menu. I know that you can ask for them, but if you're a foreigner and don't speak much Spanish (thus don't know what to ask for), it can be kind of tough. We would definitely go back to Le Reve. If you are looking for a big, touristy resort getaway, this is NOT the place for you.... If you prefer a luxurious and peaceful getaway, then I highly recommend Le Reve.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location for an end-of-Mexican-tour holiday”
Reviews.Author: ChuffersHB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after touring Mexico for 10 days. The hotel well off the beaten track, down a rough road, which means that it is quite isolated from the hustle and bustle and noise of the other, larger resorts and is consequently peaceful. We had a horizon room, with a balcony and sea view, and like one of the other couples we were also visited a couple of times in our room by a gecko, but we found it quite charming! There were plenty of beach towels, beach shoes if you wanted to go in the sea (so you wouldn't stub your toes on the rocks) however we just wore our own sandals into the sea and the sea was, I have to say, clean, warm and amazingly blue. The food was very good, although we too were brought the wrong meal on two occasions. However the waiter Roberto was so charming and the food so good we didn't really care! Each night when our bed was turned down we were left a delightful plate of sweet cakes/pastries with a little homily about "dreams" - lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic, Private Retreat”
Reviews.Author: guessica
Reviews.Content: Our week at Le Rêve was perfect. The place is idyllic: the beach private, the natural setting stunning, and the hotel itself tasteful and well-designed. We spent our days going from beach to pool to room, totally content and feeling restored. The pool is gorgeous and designed around the property's original palm and almond trees, and the beach is lovely too - rocky where the water begins as I think others have said, but perfectly swimmable with water shoes (provided). And as a bonus, the rocks make for interesting snorkeling (snorkeling equipment is also provided). The type of service is something I feel like Le Rêve has just right. The folks who work there are friendly and available but unobtrusive - Jesus, Roberto (makes a mean margarita), and Antonio and others made us feel well taken care of. Our room - a garden room - was just right: comfortable bed, plenty of hot water, and a lovely porch that opened onto a partial view of the sea even though it was on the ground floor. The garden surrounding the room made it feel secluded even though we were in the main building. We slept well every day, and woke up rested each morning at sunrise, which is totally out of character for me! Breakfast was great (and included) and the rest of the restaurant's dishes were fine to good (we ate the delicious guacamole for lunch pretty much every day) . . . and if you ask the chef will prepare Yucatan specialties off-menu for dinner. We had cochinita pibil - a slow-roasted pork dish. Yum! And maybe the best thing about this place is that it feels emptier than it is - you feel as though you have the whole place to yourself even though it's relatively full. The design of the hotel seems to be the key: there's plenty of space for everyone at pool and beach and both are equally nice - and when you're at the pool you don't really see down on the beach (you just see the sea) and when at the beach you don't notice the pool. Anything I could say I didn't like would just be nitpicking. A note about some of the other reviews: throughout our stay my husband and I chuckled at some of the nits people found with this place that justified bad reviews. Did we have mosquitos in our room one night? Yep. Were they there because *we* left the porch doors open that night? Yep. We were in the jungle, and I certainly would not have preferred that the hotel chemically fumigate the property to save us from ourselves. Some of this is the product of differing expectations: this is a boutique hotel, not a huge resort. There is only one restaurant with one menu, which was perfectly suited to us but could get boring if you were used to having six to choose from. The staff were not hovering around us, watching for any sign that we needed something, which was a relief to us but could have made someone else feel ignored (to clarify, we NEVER felt ignored and never once wanted for something, it's just that we weren't constantly fending off intrusive waitstaff when we didn't need anything). We had the perfect week at Le Rêve - we'll definitely be back for a long weekend!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC RESORT - INTIMATE, COZY, EXCELLENT FOOD, STAFF AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: malcolmgray
Reviews.Content: We took a group of 28 people to celebrate a 40th birthday. It was the PERFECT place to have a small group to celebrate a fantastic event. The organization for the event was flawless ( thank you Arlenis and Mariana). The staff attentive, fun and accommodating. The food was excellent. Did I say the food was EXCELLENT? It really was....amazing.. The rooms comfortable, clean and the beach and pool, wonderful. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kikislc
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip via Jetsetter. We've been to Playa before & stayed @ the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Obviously it's not the BT, but we enjoyed ourselves nonetheless. It's a great value for a charming boutique hotel that's quiet, relaxing and romantic. The food was great & reasonably priced. The staff was very kind. If you're into tacky large resorts, bad all inclusive food, annoying guest....this place is NOT for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a peaceful isolated place, perfect for a 5-7 days escape”
Reviews.Author: Totiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 days: clean rooms, perfect hotel size, quiet and peaceful. The staff is very Friendly and excellent (thanks Ivan, Emilia and Jesus!). The hotel is 15mins away from Playa del Carmen, perfect for a day escape to Cozumel and do some scuba diving.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: G-nature
