Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via its website and chose the sunday arrival special promotion, which included a free wednesday night stay as well as receiving 80 dollars/day resort credit for food and beverage, on top of daily complimentary breakfast. 6 day stay for bout 1100 dollars including taxes and fees. Arrived at the resort via a side road off the highway, and yes, the dirt road is still filled with huge potholes but nothing any ordinary car can't handle. Check in was effortless and we were given a quick tour of the hotel by the very friendly concierge. Rooms were good sized, clean and included your own grassy yard, outdoor tub and literally a couple feet away from the beach. The pool, poolside bar and spa area were tastefully designed and the beach was beautiful with nice huts, a hammock and free snorkels and water shoes available for use. The beach around the hotel though is rocky and isn't particularly suited for swimming unless you walk a short distance upwards. Hotel staff overall were courteous and helpful. Ismael made great cocktails and you have to ask for the coffee flambe (quite an experience). Food at the hotel's restaurant Naay was overall pretty superb. Daily homemade breads and yogurt with honey as well as the chef's own special habanero sauce is to die for. There is a daily turndown service as well which includes a different small desert treat waiting for you every night. Things which could be improved on would be the gym. The weight machine is essentially a piece of junk that doesn't work, and the area itself is pretty small and cramped, but I guess people don't go to resorts to work out till their nuts explode. Overall, great value for money, considering we payed less then 1100 for 5 night stay, and pretty much took care of food and beverage for the entire trip. Also a nice little secluded piece of paradise away from the typical young, noisy and annoying spring breakers. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Relaxing, Simple, No-Hassle Fantasticness...”
Reviews.Author: amandakr
Reviews.Content: Le Reve is such a perfect sized hotel (25 rooms - adults only) that I have no idea why I have ever stayed at the larger resorts on the Mexican Riviera. The staff treat the hotel as if it is their own, their attitude is attentive but relaxed, so you never feel intruded upon. The accomodations are lovely. We stayed in a ground floor garden suite that felt incredibly private. My only minor complaint is that the outdoor roman tub in the garden suite takes about two hours to fill up and so is cold by the time you do actually get it filled up, its not particularly usable. We purchased the room through Jetsetter.com which was a great deal - Le Reve is a total bargain for what you get. The food was very good, especially lunch where you had a choice of about 15 ceviches among other selections. Breakfast is included in the room rate and is excellent with a lot of choice. We ate several dinners at the hotel and the food was reasonable priced and very good. The beach is lovely, in its own little area that is uncrowded. The shoreline is very rocky in front of the hotel, but we just walked north about 5 minutes to a stretch where there were no rocks whenever we wanted to jump in. Proximity to Playa Del Carmen is great. Had dinner at the Banyan Tree one night to mix things up which was lovely but very expensive. Worth doing once while you are there. All in all, totally enjoyable and relaxing and I only missed not having a television the first night (Oscar night!). I would definitely go back to Le Reve.

Reviews.Title: “There was much to enjoy but a few serious short comings.”
Reviews.Author: ingrid58
Reviews.Content: First of all, Le Reve is a charming small hotel with some very friendly staff and a great wedding planner. It is in a nice location and despite being by other big hotels manages to feel private. There are some nice staff there as well. But we left being annoyed at some serious aspects of the hotel. First, It has a cold pool. Secondly, we were paying a lot to be there and felt more than a litttle nickel and dimed. They should consider an all inclusive package, especially for weddings when the hotel is bought out by a group, which would make for a more relaxing experience. We understand that it was not an all inclusive but it still felt negatively because one of our boys got sick likely from the food while there, and after getting a bowl of broth sent to our room, I was annoyed to be charged $10 US for the soup. I would feel more positive about our experience had they sent the soup gratis with a nice note from the staff saying that they hoped he was feeling better. They knew he was very sick and we became trapped inside the room for two days with him. Simple gestures would have been nice and would have gone a long way with us. We also got constantly nickel and dimed about drinks (for example, being asked to sign a ticket for even untouched bottles of water, and even at the wedding when there was an open bar we got approached to sign a bill ticket for a cocktail). Finally, we had a bug infestation in our room, and suffered dozens of unsightly bites. The hotel admitted they were going to bomb before we got there to deal with the bugs but had decided not to.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: callumx
Reviews.Content: Le Reve is a beautifully designed hotel. Located just a few kilometres up the coast from the centre of Playa. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurant was of a high quality. The fact that there are only 26 rooms, and that it is adults only, means that the hotel always feels calm and relaxed. There was never more than one person in the swimming pool and always plenty of choice re which sun lounger to relax on. Also with so few guests, it means that the beach front is also quiet and spacious. The gym is very basic (just a couple of spin bikes, a multi gym and some free weights). A great place to relax and unwind for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: paulcrystal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at Le Reve and had a wonderful, relaxing time. We were wanting a peaceful getaway and that was exactly what we experienced. For one of the days there, we had purchased a vow renewal package that included a minister and ceremony, with set-up, flowers and a dinner on the beach. This extra package was worth every penny! Arlenis, the wedding coordinator, communicated with us regularly prior to our stay to get all the details lined up perfectly. Shortly after our arrival, she came out to meet us and let us know that they even had a room set aside for my husband to get ready in, so we could each get ready on our own, in anticipation of our renewal ceremony. We were delighted by all the sweet, thoughtful personal touches like this that we experienced during our stay. The ceremony was sweet, with lovely decor and flowers and the minister, arranged for by Arlenis, had also been in communication with us to have just the vows we wanted to say to personalize things. On a side note, I hired Doranna in Playa to come out and do my hair, which was amazing-can't recommend her enough-and we hired Ashley, with Blue Lens Caribe, to take photos of the ceremony and on the beach-again, amazing...highly recommend! Each of these individuals communicated with us regularly, promptly and professionally, always answering questions and giving ideas and guidance to make our day unique, personal and very special. We were very impressed. The dinner on the beach the evening of our renewal ceremony was romantic and lovely. We had Roberto as our own personal waiter and he was just the right person for the job. The set-up was wonderful and everything was done to make us feel very special and cared for. No assumptions were made on the part of the staff, rather, we were asked for our preferences in most instances, from the location of the table set-up to the menu to the wine. Lovely! We stayed in a Bungalow suite, with a private plunge pool and a direct view of the ocean. It was a joy to fall asleep each nite to the sound of the surf and breeze. We were able to spend what time we wanted in the sun right on the beach in front of our room and then cool off in our plunge pool any time we desired. The room was crisp, cool and the bed incredibly like sleeping on a cloud! There was ample storage space in a series of built-in cabinets so that we were able to make ourselves feel at home. The service at Le Reve is beyond comparison. The staff is wonderfully friendly without it feeling gratuitous and we were constantly met by wonderful smiles and gentle voices. I am amazed that they all wear long pants and dress shoes, even to walk through the beach sand to bring a drink or snack! Everyone looked crisp and professional. The location and grounds of Le Reve are really special. My husband and I walked both north and south quite a ways and looked at every hotel location we passed, since this was our first trip to the area. We didn't see anything that even compared to the serene beauty and crisp aesthetic of Le Reve. It was amazing to see the difference between Le Reve's unique combo of cozy and chic and all the larger resorts with their hundreds of beach chairs laid out in rows. I'm sure other places are nice to stay but we agreed over and over that we had chosen just the right place and were always so glad to return to our special room and hotel. Food at the restaurant was quite good. Some have commented that it isn't great and I would agree that it isn't superb for lunch or dinner but it is quite good and the presentation, location and service, I think, more than make up for any slight deficiencies. We thought the breakfasts were amazing and tasty, however. Finally, my only negative comment, and this is just a nitpicky thing, I realize: I was surprised, with the price of the room we were paying, to see that many of the towels and beach bed covers were in pretty shabby condition. The grounds were in constant focus, with the steps from the lobby being re-painted and the pool deck being re-stained, a little at a time over our stay so I know that the hotel appearance is of utmost import at Le Reve. But, our beach bed had a large hole in the cover a couple of mornings and many of our towels were frayed around the outside edges. There were also a few stains/snags on the mosquito netting around the bed. This is a very minute detail that in no way will keep us from coming back but was something I noticed. Overall a wonderful, relaxing stay. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Visually stunning and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Discerning1945
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this small, friendly hotel that's successfully designed for visual impact. Our 2nd floor room in the main building had an ample balcony overlooking the pool (not very deep) and out to the sea. The view was a bit blocked by some trees. But they also provided some privacy, given the entire front wall is glass (with curtains). The hotel staff was extremely responsive and helpful, particularly the concierge, Jesus. The restaurant, which was under our room, faces the same way. Food was quite good and beautifully presented, but overpriced for what it is. Breakfast, included in room price, had about 8 items, but lacked any healthy cereal or whole grain options, not even whole wheat bread. Too heavy on eggs, cheese and white bread. Waitstaff was friendly but uneven. in skill Had to ask more than once for coffee, the check and even a napkin (once). One waiter we seemed to get stuck with kept filling one of our coffee cups but not mine, which was empty. Also, the waitstaff makes a lot of noise clanking plates and such when they set up early in the morning before breakfast. Since several rooms (including ours) are directly over the restaurant, this is a problem and woke us up early every day. The one significant downside is that there is not a single chair in the whole place (except at the dining tables) that provides any back support! Not in the rooms, not at the pool, nowhere. They all curve and lean back., except for some couches in the lounge that have very long seat depths -- too long for anyone but a tall person to be able to sit straight in and still have one's feet touch the floor. Chaises at the pool don't raise up far enough to support a person sitting any way other than prone. For a stay of 7 days, this became very uncomfortable and annoying. But all done for visual impact, not comfort or health.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ollie47
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Le Reve to meet up with friends and had a wonderful time at Le Reve. We booked through Jetsetters and we were not disappointed. Rooms were very nice. Staff was wonderful and the restaurant great. Would go there again in a heartbeat. Not easy to find and you must have a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like your own private retreat”
Reviews.Author: LalaB94
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Le Reve, everything just went smoothly. The staff is absolutely excellent. I really can't compliment them enough. There was always someone around if we needed something, without ever feeling like we were being hovered over. We had a garden room and as an unexpected bonus had a lovely ocean view. Overall the room was very comfortable and I found the simple decor to be rather soothing. Blackout drapes were a great touch considering that morning sun is very intense. We ate most of our meals there and found the food to be very good. If you wanted something that was not on the menu, the staff was happy to accommodate. The margaritas were great! The property as a whole really lovely. There are plenty of lounge chairs for everyone, both at the pool and on the beach. The beach is a bit rocky at the waters edge, but the hotel provides water shoes, as well as snorkeling gear. The only annoyance we found was that the very large hotel nearby has wave runners that were very loud and sometimes a little too close to shore. I would highly recommend Le Reve and am looking forward to returning. Maybe next time I'll splurge on one of the bungalows.

Reviews.Title: “A tough place to review”
Reviews.Author: shocknick
Reviews.Content: Why was Le Reve so tough to grade? Well, simply because it's hard to say unkind things about nice people. And that's what the people who work here are, nice people. Kind, attentive and would do everything in their power to please you so that you enjoy your stay. Unfortunately, there were some shortcomings that the kindness of the employees couldn't make up for. The food really is mediocre. It's not overpriced, but it's also not up to standard you'd expect from looking at the hotel. We arrived on Valentine's Day and had the special dinner. It was an 8-course extravaganza, but with some very strange dishes being served. A salad dish that I liked to refer to as a "deconstructed Subway" - served on a bed of pickles. A mint sorbet, which was supposed to be a pallet cleanser midway through the course, was so unbelievably minty (think mint-choc chip ice-cream, without the choc-chips) it left me feeling like i'd had dessert and was done with my meal. However, the main course was next and mine and my lady's dishes were both overcooked. A medium steak served VERY well-done and my lamb chops fully cooked, without a hint of pink. You get the idea, all the food was beautifully presented, but of average flavor. In our room, the bed was a Queen, and there wasn't much space for anything bigger than that. We had a beautiful view of the ocean, but the room was directly above the restaurant and we could hear noise early in the morning and late in the evening, which made sleep hard. The noise of the shutters being creaked closed to protect from the ocean breeze each night and then reopened every morning still shrieks through my body... The road leading to the hotel is a dirt track that is in serious need of paving. Everything is fine until you pass the entry big All-inclusive resort but then it just ends and you have to navigate a maze of deep potholes for the final half mile. I would recommend to Le Reve they get this paved ASAP, as they may get more customers from it. Without TV's in the room, if you want to relax and avoid socializing in the evening, you're left with little choices other than reading. There was a small DVD library, but there was a charge of $5 to borrow one for the evening, and they were mainly knock-offs! I thought this was a little cheeky. If Le Reve was a human, I think it would be a small-town beauty pageant contestant - beautiful to look at, warm-hearted and caring about her family, animals and the environment, but a little lacking of intelligence and trying to get through life on looks alone. We like to have freedom to move about and normally stay in a condo down in Akumal, on the beach, so maybe this was a little too claustrophobic for our travel tastes. I don't think I'd come back, but it was a nice enough stay with good weather and very relaxing. It was nice to have a car so we could drive into Playa each day and get some food there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but falls short in the little details sometimes.”
Reviews.Author: lagosr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, very nice low-key style, we stayed in a beach front bungalow, and got to fall asleep every night listening to the sounds of the ocean. -- I think you'd be hard pressed to find another breach-front room for the same price in Playa. -- it is a good value. The hotel gets alot of notes right, and some not so right. For cleanliness I have to give them 5 stars (out of 5), our room was always spotless and I saw the staff working tirelessly every morning to make the hotel look perfect (and the did). The concierge was great, they were at our service and helped us plan outings, and took care of details for us, such as renting cars, returning cars, calling local business, etc. The places where the hotel falls short was in the restaurant service, we noticed that the consistency of the service was just not up to par with the type of resort that Le Reve is, for example, the staff sometimes forgets small details about the order you made, (ie: forgets the bread, or forgets napkins, or your plate might come with a slightly altered dish that you were expecting). These by themselves are not a big deal, but for me, they break the spell that a luxury resort is weaving, and then i had to worry about asking for napkins, or asking for bread, etc, etc. Not a deal breaker, but i noticed. -- by the same token, alot of the staff does work extra hard to be friendly. -- The restaurant menu did not change for our entire stay, we highly recomend their apetizers, they were incredible .. but their main dishes were just ok, nothing worth writing home about. We also did have a non-functioning AC unit in our room for 2 nights, but I can hardly blame the hotel for that, once we reported it and demanded that it be fixed, it was repaired and we had no more problems with it. One comment that I left for the management, was to introduce themselves to the guests, and make themselves available, so in case things are not going 100% smoothly, the guests feels welcome to bring it up and have it handled. -- I only met the general manager after being at the hotel 4 or 5 days, and then it was only by chance. The beds are incredible, and the beautiful animals crafted by the housekeeping staff are a great touch. If you are looking for a hotel with WiFi, then you probably want to stay in one of their suites or garden view rooms, the WiFi signal did not reach our breachfront bungalow (we had the furthest one from the main building on the property though)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Boutique Resort with 5-Star Service”
Reviews.Author: JVestal
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Le Reve in Jan 2011 was everything we had hoped. Thanks to Jetsetter we got a great deal, but I would recommend this boutique resort even at retail price. There are I believe 4 types of rooms – garden, balcony, master suite, and beach bungalow. We stayed in a garden room, and I think I would prefer it to the balcony room because there is a large outdoor soaking tub that gets hot water—the Jacuzzi section of the *gorgeous* infinity pool does not appear to have heat, so if you are looking for the hot tub experience, this outdoor tub is great for just relaxing in the evenings with a drink or a book. The value of the service at Le Reve is amazing. The staff/guest ratio is so high, at peak times I think there was a staff member on site for each of the 25 rooms! The staff is extremely well trained to attend to your every need, but no one was at all overbearing, annoying, or sales-y. As far as food goes, I am used to Chicago food prices and these seemed reasonable to me. One thing to keep in mind is that all prices include tax AND gratuity. The chef was excellent. I was at first a bit nervous about the food as I had heard it was mostly American-influenced and I like authentic Mexican food. No problem—each evening after dinner, our server Ismael and the Chef worked together to give us authentic options to plan the next night’s meal. We had pork cochinita, a whole roasted fish for 2, barbacoa, chlles rellenos, chicken mole, and barbecue ribs. Our favorites were the barbacoa, chiles rellenos and barbecue ribs, but everything was excellent. We are not big drinkers, but the drinks were well prepared and the service again was excellent. The grounds are kept meticulously every morning and throughout the day—there is not a stone or leaf out of place, ever. There are also nice touches like afternoon tea at 4:30-5pm and nightly turn down service with a little dessert treat. Room service is no extra charge, and neither is pool service, beach service or wherever-you-want-to-eat service. Overall this hotel gives the feel of a hidden gem with a relaxed, quiet atmosphere. Down the beach to both directions are all-inclusive/annoying spring break type resorts with 1000s of beach chairs, loud music, etc. do yourself a favor and stay at Le Reve. You won’t be disappointed. Would recommend setting up a day trip to Xel-Ha which is great for snorkeling. Also if you want great wood fired pizza, walk down the beach to the left of the resort, past Azul and the Tides is a path up from the beach to a tiny place called Coco Cabanas. Bring cash as they do not take credit card. Great for a lunch or mid afternoon snack.

Reviews.Title: “EXTRAORDINARY. CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK.”
Reviews.Author: NMWW
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous setting on the beach a few miles north of Playa del Carmen. Understated elegance, immaculate maintenance, excellent service WITH A SMILE, extradordinary food. Small, quiet (no children allowed). Tasteful and beautiful, everywhere the eye happens to rest. Wood and wicker, no plastic in sight. A real dream (pun intended!). Minor nuisance (to us): no wireless service one day of five, no telephone service two days.

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS VIEWS AND WONDERFUL SERVICE MADE FOR A PERFECT ENGAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: MDP007
Reviews.Content: WONDERFUL STAFF I would first like to thank the amazing staff for making our experience at Le Reve absolutely phenomenal. The beauty of this natural paradise is only rivaled by the impeccable service offered by the staff at Le Reve. Without my knowledge of the events that were about to transpire, my fiance along with chief concierge, Jaqueline, and fellow staff worked together to set up a proposal that would be any girls dream! BEACH AND EXCURSIONS The gorgeous beach was literally just footsteps away from our beautiful, clean, garden suit. On the beach, courtesy of Le Reve there are plenty of hammocks and huge, comfortable beach lounge chairs. Le Reve also provides snorkeling gear. In the afternoon we decided to walk down the beach and we found a person selling excursions to nearby places such as the Tulum, Xel-xa, and Chichen Itza. We chose to do an excursion for the second day of our trip that included visiting Tulum and then spending the rest of the day at Xel-xa. Transportation was included in the $95 per person rate (and yes this is for BOTH Tulum and Xel-xa). Tulum is where the Mayan ruins are. We were provided with an english speaking guide and then were allowed to go roam the beach for a little bit. I wish we had more time to explore here. The beach was amazing and actually reminded me of the movie Pirates of the Caribbean. Next we were transported to Xel-Xa, an amazing amusement park that is home to the world's largest natural aquarium. Here we snorkeled, went tubing, zip-lined, jumped off of cliffs, swam in caves, and saw many animals such as manatees, dolphins, and parrots. Unlimited food and drink, including alcohol was included, in our $95 admission. DINNER AND MY WONDERFUL ENGAGEMENT If you would like, Le Reve can arrange for you and your special someone to have dinner either on the beach, or in the spa (which is an open structure that overlooks the beach). My fiance arranged to have a surprise dinner (and ultimately a surprise proposal) for me at the spa, which was amazing. We had a gorgeous view of the beach and the staff at Le Reve had tiki torches burning which made it even more beautiful. The food was extremely delicious! When we returned back to our room, we saw that our amazing Chief Concierge Jaqueline (who is absolutely wonderful), decorated our room with swans and rose petals. It was so beautiful and romantic. Jaqueline, thank you so much for making my engagement such a wonderful, unforgettable and unique experience, I cannot thank you enough!!!!! ROOM We had the Garden Suit as I mentioned before. Personally, I think these rooms are the BEST! We had a view of the infinity pool and the ocean, and we had what is called a roman bath. This is an outdoor bath that has both hot and cold water. That meant that we could sit in our roman bath at night, even when it was a little chilly. Around our little garden were Jasmine bushes giving us the perfect amount of privacy. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was beautiful. I loved the rainshower. We spent very little time inside of the room, which was extremely clean, and spent a lot of time in the Roman bath, especially at night (we absolutely loved it!). Will we be coming back? Absolutely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service & delicious food, little disappointed about the beach.”
Reviews.Author: moniaolo
Reviews.Content: We have had a relaxing stay at this hotel in Jan 2011 The food was best we have had in Mexico, breakfast delicious ( except NO freshly squeezed orange juice was served). Cocktails just perfect. Outstanding staff, very friendly & engaging. The rooms are beautifully designed. The only thing I could complain a little was the beach. It is certainly with a lot of " character" & you have to wear shoes if you want to go for a swim in the sea, walking over little coral formations & tiny sea urchins. Also depending on the time of the day & wind there is a smell of fuel & often noise from the jet-ski's going up & down along the beach stretch, sometimes very close to the swimming area which is cordoned off for safety. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Now”
Reviews.Author: VuilleHadi
Reviews.Content: Leave the kids, laptop and cellphones behind! This is for the grown ups. With only 25 rooms it is a gem in Playa which is packed with lovely but impersonal monster resorts. If you're looking for privacy, great food and personal service this is the place. Freddy and Roberto both made the best margaritas I've ever had and Ivan the finest strawberry daiquiri. The beach is a delight, uncrowded, cleaned daily and the sand groomed. Just stroll 1/2 mile and check out the other beaches...though not inexpensive, remember you get what you pay for. If you want to check out, check in to Le Reve.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Playa”
Reviews.Author: charwood525
Reviews.Content: Great spot. Lovely service. Great value. It's not the banyan tree, but it's less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Le Reve........"the dream" come true!”
Reviews.Author: rhomalo
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a fabulous 4 night stay in December at Le Reve. We traveled with another couple and had THE BEST time. We arrived to a tranquil spot, and could not believe the view. The beach was just magnificent. The staff were so accomodating on arrival and throughout our stay. The complementary breakfast was outstanding.. couldnt believe this was part of the price of the room ( which was very good to start with). We stayed in the master suite which exceeded our expectations. Huge wow factor and we highly recommend it. The view from the balcony and the spaciousness added so much to the experience. It was a wonderful each day to start with breakfast and then take a long walk on the beach which goes for miles each way. The beach changes shape and has a lot of character as you walk along especially going left out of the hotel. Yes there were rocks, in front of the hotel, but my husband brought water shoes and had NO trouble getting out. The hotel also provides these along with snorkel gear. We went into Playa to have dinner most nights and had a great time... COCO bongo is a must if you want to see what the hype is all about It really was an experience that I cannot explain, but we would not normally go to a venue like this, as it seemed too touristy, but it really was AMAZING. Check it out. Dinner at La Tourtouga was fabulous and so well priced. The bar and food at Diavliato in town was funky and cool. Ceveiche everywhere was great, but you MUST check out the ceviche and the Pizza as well as the very cool couple who owns Coco Cabana's near our hotel. It is walking distance from the hotel, on the beach if you go left. It is behind the Tides hotel. Very "local" and authentic and delicious. As far as the hotel, again the staff were so friendly, from checkin Amelia, and at the bar all the servers were exceptional. Roberto took great care of us, fabulous drinks and food. The staff made sure that my husbands birthday was acknowledged a few time throughout the day of, and the made it so personal, which was nice. If you are looking for a place to relax that has a great cool atmosphere then Le Reve is a must. We will definately be back again next year

Reviews.Title: “Never judge a book by its driveway”
Reviews.Author: Eufouric
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Le Reve for Thanksgiving this year and it was by far, the best trip I'd ever been on. As many of the reviews have said, the Staff is amazing. The level of attention and care that you receive at Le Reve is something that can only be experienced at a small boutique hotel. We walked along the beach to check out the other hotels, and granted some had better beach fronts or larger pools, our hotel had an intimate feel and the staff treated us like royalty. We ate and drank on the beach pretty much everyday. Our drinks never ran too low and our plates were never empty before someone would come down to our lounge or hammock to ask if we wanted anything else. And at night, we would always find cute little desserts and inspirational quotes on our turned down beds. I can't even get into all the wonderful little touches that this remarkable staff did to make our trip special. My only concern with the hotel, and its one that I think the hotel should definitely take into consideration, is the road leading up to the hotel. Before we went on this trip, I read ALL of TripAdivsor's reviews and I was somewhat prepared for the "dirt road." But it was so much worst than I imagined. So bad even, that we tried to cancel our reservation. The pot holes are the size of cars and it takes about 15 min just to get to the main road because cars/buses have to come to almost complete stops just to maneuver around the pot holes. I'm so thankful that we weren't able to cancel our reservation (no refund policy) because we ended up having the time of our lives, but Le Reve deserves a lead-up that speaks to the level of service and caliber of the hotel. Oh...last note. The food! The food is amazing! Breakfast is free and its crazy how many great options you have to choose from. Lunch and dinner were also great.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to our paradise”
Reviews.Author: sveeranarong
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Le Reve Hotel and Spa in mid-November for our honeymoon. We only had a a short time to getaway and we were looking for something relatively close with white sandy beaches and beautiful accommodations. Le Reve was perfect. Everyone was welcoming and attentive, particularly the concierge and restaurant staff. The hotel is quite small but perfect if you are looking to be away from crowds. Because it is a slower season in November we had the luxury of having most of the hotel to ourselves. The property is well kept, the beach is combed, everyone is friendly and helpful, and the restaurant is delicious! A great getaway from the hustle of NYC. Liked best: Privacy and coziness, most delicious breakfast, cleanliness of the property, staff Liked least: Mosquitos (although the conceirge did their absolute best to make us as comfortable as possible)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Utrecht17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a week and were not dissapointed. Everything about this place was wonderful. The room was beautiful with a nice balcony overlooking the pool and sea. The staff was absolutely wonderful especially wonderful. You should definitely try one of the cocktails, they were delicious. The beach was beautiful and very quiet and last but not least, the food was wonderful. We did in Playa del Carmen one night and the staff recommended us to an italian restaurant which was also wonderful. So if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing, romantic place you should definitely go to the Le Reve

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding & Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: laurelxo
Reviews.Content: After reading all the rave reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor I decided this would be the perfect place to get married and have our honeymoon…and I was not disappointed! Everything about this hotel was amazing! We wanted something small and exclusive (without the price) and that is exactly what we got. Since we went in slow season, we felt like we had the resort to ourselves. The hotel is only 25 rooms and at most, 8 rooms were filled during our stay. Arlenis, the wedding coordinator, was great to work with and helped us create the perfect, intimate beach wedding. She handled all the details and was on top of everything! The food at the hotel was mouthwatering. I was concerned that we would get bored eating at the same restaurant for most of our meals, but we found by the end of the week we actually preferred eating at the hotel versus going into town because the food was so AMAZING. If you are looking for a quiet, romantic getaway where you relax by the pool and on the beach, this is the place for you. If you are looking for more interaction with other hotel guests, or a party atmosphere this is not for you. Be aware this hotel is off the beaten path, so it takes 10-15 minutes to get into town, but well worth it in my opinion! The staff gets to know you, is extremely friendly and enjoys interacting with the guests. Both Valentino and Jacqueline (concierges) were extremely helpful when we asked for restaurant recommendations or wanted to rent a car to drive to Tulum. Eight days went to fast and they had to drag us back to the airport kicking & screaming ☺

Reviews.Title: “A Few More Steps & Le Reve Could Be Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MrsDallasMatt
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked Le Reve over the 3 day Labor Day weekend. We also have a difference in opinion on Le Reve and maybe he'll post his side. Couples huh.................. We booked the most expensive room in the house which was an oceanfront casita with private pool. When they said ocean front it truly meant ocean front. The casita was less than 10 feet from the beach itself. Incredible. Here's the list of "a few more steps to excellence" - At the price point of the casita using other 4 to 5 stars hotels we stayed at as a basis: The airconditioner didn't work, we moved to a different casita but the air conditioning couldn't keep up. Since the casita has a thatched roof I assume it can't cool. Talked to another casita couple from the Midwest and they had the same issue. Le Reve has room service, neither casita had a room service menu I had to ask for the large bulky menus from the restaurant and keep them in the room. Turn down service 1 night of the 3, never emptied the trash never left clean towels. The bathroom as in water closet/toliet has no door. My pet peeve might not bother others. The bathroom counter had two sinks so there wasn't any space to put down a makeup bag or shaving kit. Bottom line - improve turn down, leave towels and room service menu, invest in a better split air conditioning unit and for those shy gals who like bathroom time to be me time, maybe a door in the commode area. Here's the 4 star part : Food -Breakfast as in a "full breakfast" is including in our rate. NICE loved it and they will serve that comp breakfast in your casita. Food overall was good, one night not so good and they comped it and the staff was sweet about the comp. Staff- They are 5 star perfect. The perfect combination of friendly without overly in your face friendly, professional, talkative, accomodating and concerned that you have a wonderful experience. I can't say enough great things about Le Reve's staff. Love Jacquline the manager and Freddy our waiter for both food & drinks. Spa- I didn't exactly see a spa room per say but my husband and I had an excellent massage. Le Reve has a 2 story open air tower above the pool area where our massage took place so we had a nice breeze and the ocean in our ears during service. My massage was swedish and I put the massage itself in my top 5 list. Beach/Pool Area/Bar - Again this hotel is on the beach, very very close to the shore. It doesn't get any better than that. Nice pool, wish there were steps to get into the pool for those of us older travelers, it's hard on the knees. There is a slope on one side to walk in though. Great cocktails served by great staff. Location - 50 minutes to Cancun Airport. 15 to 20 minutes to downdown Playa Del Carmen. On the same strip of beach as The Tides if you're familar with the area. Overall - Small boutique hotel, a lot of heart & charm. Would I return.........yes but not at the casita rate since it didn't deliver the goods at that price. This hotel is ideal for couples, honeymooners. Great to hold a wedding where you rent the entire hotel. Euro's would also love the rustic Yucatan feel to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for your Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CALaufman
Reviews.Content: My (now) husband and I went to Le Reve for our Honeymoon. We had an outstanding time. The service was stellar (especially Valentino!), the food wonderful and the atmosphere extremely romantic. I would recommend it for romantic couples ONLY and if you are the type of people that thrive on seclusion and privacy. There are no TVs and other guests kept to themselves for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible - the best hospitality I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: RWat
Reviews.Content: Le Reve is a unique and special boutique resort that has the highest level of service I have ever experienced! you will not regret staying at Le Reve. I would recommend it to anybody (except if you are traveling with children) and I can't wait to go back!! thank you for living up to my expectation and making my holiday so special!

Reviews.Title: “Simply PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: TomGiffordNY
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I are currently planning our destination wedding in Mexico and Le Reve was on our list of possible venues. So we decided to travel down there and see if the pictures and good reviews were actually true. After renting a car in Cancun, we drove the incredibly easy 45min to the Playa Del Carmen area and turned off onto a dirt and headed toward the beach. After only a few minutes on the little back road, we came upon Le Reve and what can only be described as one of the most beautiful hotel lobbies I have ever seen. From the moment you arrive, you are surrounded by incredible views of the ocean. The entire hotel has an open feel to it and yet it feels cozy when you are there. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly the entire time. Our amazing waiter Freddy even gave my fiance some of their secret (and amazing!) hot sauce to take home. Speaking of food, the restaurant is simply amazing! Our breakfast every morning was truly delicious! Fresh fruit, fresh bread, delicious entree! I could on and on about every part of this hotel and how wonderful it is, but you obviously get my opinion on it. Needless to say, we are definitely having our wedding here and couldn't think of a better hotel or better staff to share this occasion with.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: Anntrips
Reviews.Content: The staff at Le Reve was great!!!! We felt right at home from the moment the taxi dropped us off. Everyone at Le Reve was always looking out for us without being overwhelming. Tasty drinks and snacks were brought over with just a wave of our hand. Everyone greeted us by our names which made us feel special. This hotel is perfect for a romantic getaway, the location was a bit difficult to get to but once you get there you forget about the rest of the world! We spent most of our days at the infinity pool or at the terrace of our Master Suite (the views were incredible). We've already made arrangements for our next weekend getaway. We loved the Riviera Maya as it is convenient and close to travel from NY and it makes a perfect escape from the city.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem - literally”
Reviews.Author: rpolicicio
Reviews.Content: Spent my honeymoon there - amazing romatic hotel. Rooms are great, great elegant decor, very comfortable and private. All amenities are there, and the room we stayed at was right at the beach - what an incredible sensation. Staff was incredible - breakfast was included at the rate and was delicious. Pool is amazing - looks small at first but then you remember it's a small/private hotel, so the pool is big enough. The beach are is also great, big doubt about where to spend the day - pool or beach? It's not cheap, but it's worth the price for special moments. The only note is that you really need a car to get to this hotel - it's a bit isolated (which adds a lot of charm and privacy to your stay) and you have to pay close attention to the signs to get there (specially at night) and be aware thats a land road. 15 min driving from Playa, so it was easy to get there for dinner and night fun - just take care with the Mexican policemen at the road - they will try to extort money from you at any cost, as they know it's a very touristic road - watch the speed limit and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and secluded”
Reviews.Author: drubs
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful trip to the Riviera Maya and we had a fantastic stay at Le Reve. My husband and I visited Le Reve because some friends of ours recommended the place to us. This was such a great recommendation. The location was perfect. Secluded yet not too far of the main attractions. We found the Riviera maya not only fabulous for it's beaches but its also an area rich in historical and cultural places. We were able to visit so many interesting archaelogical sites around the area. Le Reve is gorgeous and the staff made us feel like very welcome. The food was delicious. Do not miss out on the "Beef Ceviche"!. Thanks to everyone at Le Reve for making this happen. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Paradise”
Reviews.Author: hhart1nyc
Reviews.Content: Le Reve is an enchanting boutique hotel away from bustle of Playa del Carmen. The setting is perfect, the staff is friendly and helpful (Jacqueline is a delight), and the food is excellent and reasonably priced for a hotel of this type (the rummed-up smoothies were out of this world). We prefer to travel in the low season to avoid crowds and Le Reve was a perfect get away. We loved the clever eco-friendly "green" (vegetation) ventilation for the bathroom and shower areas. My husband and I were able to do our yoga & pilates in the open air fitness room located on the beach -- heavenly! But be aware of the hotel's only road that is terribly pitted (with what could be easily described as sink holes) due to the rest of the area being under construction. Even with the bad road, we will definitely be back to Le Reve!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for resting”
Reviews.Author: Liliperle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and very calm. It is great for couple and an amazing honeymoon. All The staff members were so helpful and kind. The food is also very good and not more expensive than in The 5th avenue of Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Le Reve is really a dream”
Reviews.Author: petersonmonica
Reviews.Content: I went down to Playa del Carmen for my husbands birthday and I had seen the pictures in their web page but I never imagined the sight and the hotel would be so amazing. We stayed there for a couple of days and we enjoyed everything in the resort. The hotel staff was so friendly and the service was excellent. The ceviches are the best things I have ever ate. We stayed at one of the bungalows and it was beautiful, we could walk up to the sea in 10 steps and the beach is quiet and just what we needed for a romantic getaway. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a good time and let themselves be treated to de best food, service and sights in Playa del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all. Amazing views, beautiful rooms, personalised service, infinity pool and an awesome bed!”
Reviews.Author: Slightly_Fussy
Reviews.Content: I agree with the posts mentioning that the bed was amazing. I liked it so much that we took a photo of the brand and make (Sealy Comfort Side) so we can buy it at home! The room was very tastefully decorated (we got the standard downstairs suite), which included a garden. The rain shower was beautiful, we heard no noise from the other suites at all. The hotel has a turndown service was lovely. The staff greet you by name and were friendly and extremely helpful. Mayra helped us book tours (I can recommend Aventuras Mayas snorkel adventure) and even our next hotel. But the thing I loved the most was the infinity pool overlooking the ocean. It was like being in a post card. Yes, it is true that the water in front of the hotel has a few rocks in it, the upside is that few people swim there making the view even more perfect. It was absolute heaven, and you can rent out the whole place (25 rooms) for a wedding if you want. The food was not stellar, breakfast, which was included to our surprise was just fine. However, dinner was a fancy but not particularly good and very expensive. It's worth paying the taxi to go into town. Lunch however was excellent we stayed for lunch on our last day so that we could the chicken tacos. They were expensive but awesome!! The pool was perfect and yes, the temperature was perfect as were the cushioned lounge chairs. There was a couple during our stay who were making out in the pool like they invented sex! However, we can hardly blame the hotel for that. If you like to sail you can rent a catamaran from the all inclusive further down the beach (who also have a nice beach) called Sandos Caracol for about $30 US for an hour. If you like the look of Le Reve you might also like to spend a couple of nights at Hotel La Amada in Playa Mujeres.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Trishtravels38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a road trip across the Mexican Peninsula and had the best stay by far at Le Reve, even after spending more money and having bigger expectations for other places. Le Reve was our favorite because of its great location, serenity and comfort. Location: Other places we stayed in were in the middle of the action (downtown Merida and Cancun) or too isolated (Tulum) and Le Reve hit the perfect balance for us. We could take a short drive in our rented car and be in Playa del Carmen's 5th Ave. for a walk with all of the other tourists and do a little souvenir shopping. There are plenty of stop lights on the way into town to slow you down even though its supposed to be a highway, but it was about 15 minutes. Serenity: My husband and I both agree that this has something to do with the location since the hotel is fairly isolated, but it's more than that. We stayed at another isolated hotel and never really got the same feeling. Maybe it was the waiters who brought us drinks on the beach or breakfast in bed as we looked out over the palm trees and beach. It's something you can't really put your finger on, but the mix of a great staff, location, food and the building itself come together to create a sort of contagious "vibe" that really put us at ease. Comfort: Great bed. Really. I can't say enough about it. Our room had a shower looking over the ocean that we really enjoyed. The pool was also at just the right temperature and the reclining deck chairs felt like they were made to fit our bodies perfectly. In short, great place. I'd definitely recommend Le Reve (we already have!) to anyone for just about anything, but especially for a vacation for couples.

Reviews.Title: “If you want it all”
Reviews.Author: jorgehenriquez
Reviews.Content: Arrving to Le Reve takes you away from it all. The sense of arrival is extra ordinary. You start out at the very modern Can Cun Airport and travel through a high way that was fine and going to get better since they are building super high speed overpass highway. You then turn into what seems a small street that brings you back to the 1960 Mexico only to arrive at the hotel on the beach. Fantastic the sense of arrivle. I came to Mexico looking for character. Something I can’t experience in the US. You arrive at the lobby that has the most incredible view of the ocean framed between two walls that begs of you to take a picture. This is how they have set up the experience for you. Starting out with this splendid view framed between the beautiful architecture of the hotel. As you go down the stairs you are greeted by the most original pool that windes its way through the grounds and tress only to invite you in. I LITERALY wanted to stop the walk to the room and jump in. We stay in a bungalow and I can’t suggest that everyone stay there. From your room you can open the back sliding window and walk a few steps right into the torques water! You can t do this in many places and for the price we paid you cant even dream about doing this. The neighboring hotels, the Mandarin Oriental and the Fairmont are charging you 1,500 per night for similar rooms. No one give you this view and proximity to the water ate the price we paid. Loved the place we are coming back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: helene1027
Reviews.Content: This was hands down the WORST experience my husband and I ever had at a resort hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE. The hotel is filthy and the staff is completely non-responsive almost to the point of being mute. The food is disgusting, the rooms are gross and very small. We vacation ALOT and this was so bad that we almost left early. I cut my foot on a piece of broken glass in the room and the staff woldn't even bother to help us. Luckily we salvaged the rest of our vacation by checking into the TIDES (directly next door). If you are going to Playa Del Carmen, stay at the TIDES, not the Le Reve....otherwise, you will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay in paradise”
Reviews.Author: FerNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at Le Reve. As soon as we arrived, the friendly staff welcomed us back and it felt like a homecoming. This place is perfect if you are looking for a scenic and serene getaway. The staff is extremely attentive yet not intrusive and they make sure that all your needs are met. If you call for room service or a drink or even a beach towel, you get it promptly unlike in large resorts where it is so crowded that you sometimes have to wait a bit for service. This hotel is a rare find. Go if you are looking for relaxation, beautiful views and romance!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: celiobrasil
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday with some friends in Le Reve. The hospitality and comfort exceeded my expectations. Excellent hotel to relax and enjoy nature and the beach, super quiet and impeccable service. Thank you Le Reve team. I will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Serene Oceanfront Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PapillonHB
Reviews.Content: First, let me say we did not stay here, didn't even see a room, but when my husband and I walked down the beach from the resort we were staying at we decided to ask if we could have a morning cup of coffee at this small stylish and serene looking place. The staff warmly welcomed us onto their open air restaurant overlooking the pool and beautiful beach beyond. We were brought complimentary sweet rolls and the friendly waiter turned on some soft Harry Connick Jr. music for us to enjoy. We were there in the late morning although we could see how beautifully-lit this area would be at night. We met the manager on duty that morning who encouraged us to return for a nice, quiet ambient dinner that evening which sounded sooo good to us! Unfortunately, as it turned out, we couldn't make it back, but it is a MUST-DO the next time we are in the Playa del Carmen area. We were anxious to find a little jewel of an escape like Le Reve after feeling a bit "trapped" at a massive and sprawling timeshare resort teeming with crowds. If you are looking for peace and quiet, soft jazz with ambient dining overlooking an infinity edge pool and the beach beyond, this is the place! Staff is very professional and attentive, very impressive!

Reviews.Title: “My top romantic getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: fmerodio
Reviews.Content: When I think of Le Reve....I just feel the need to go back and cannot wait until my next anniversary!! I highly recommend all the experience, the service, food, and most of all...the place! The bungalow suite really did it for us with our own private pool, just my husband and I... A truly romantic getaway to celebrate our 7th anniversary. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “We are looking forward to our next stay”
Reviews.Author: Laupat75
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I expected for a quite retreat with my husband. The location is secluded, the place is small which makes it feel really intimate. We stayed at a master suite and the view was truly AMAZING. The staff was so friendly and willing to make all our wishing come true! The food was amazing. Ask the waiters for their recommendation it was worth it. We are so happy we found this place! Thanks to everyone at Le Reve for making our days in the Riviera Maya unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest”
Reviews.Author: Zarap
Reviews.Content: Relaxation at it's best! The scrumptious food and excellent service make this small gem a sure fire winner. My husband and I were very pleased to find this hotel delvered on everything it offered: a quiet, hidden beach just outside of Playa del Carmen. This was our first boutique hotel experience and we're very happy with the attention and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lkh007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently enjoyed a 5-night stay at Le Reve. It was the perfect setting to relax and enjoy each other's company. The staff was EXCELLENT and accommodated every request. We looked forward to the fresh-squeezed orange juice every morning and enjoyed getting to know most of the employees by name. The waitstaff was very encouraging despite my pathetic attempts at speaking Spanish. Thanks to them- I managed to learn a few more vocabulary words! As for the location, it is fairly isolated but is an easy cab ride to downtown Playa del Carmen. The only negative thing we can say about Le Reve is their dinner menu. We were disappointed to find that it is mostly Italian/American food. We requested a Mexican/traditional dish and Antonio (our waiter) suggested trying a "Mexican platter." It was the best meal we had during our entire stay in Mexico. They MUST add it to their menu. We ate in downtown Playa and at neighboring resorts and the meals did not even come close to the meal we had. We would have eaten it every night!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: TravelingHotdish
Reviews.Content: Le Reve is a lovely, charming, little hotel. We rented a beach bungalow and it was just what we were hoping for. We got a deal through Orbitz so our review is based on the discounted price we paid. We feel it is a great boutique hotel and not a luxury hotel. The room was beautiful and the bed was perfect. We slept like babies every night. Our room looked out to our private plunge pool which was nice and refreshing after sitting on the beach. The bathroom was nice. The hot water took a little bit to warm up which is what I would expect in a developing country and we were never in a hurry so it didn't matter. The beach was clean and well kept and not very crowded. This was definitely not the case at the large hotels near by. The ocean was warm and good for swimming if the winds were down. The hotel provide snorkeling gear and a sea kayak at no cost. They also provide water shoes which are necessary if you walk in the ocean as there is a little coral and rock. Breakfast was delicious. We highly recommend trying the local dishes on the menu as they are very flavorful and an nice change from traditional eggs and toast. They offer freshly squeezed juices which are also definitely worth a try. We only ate one dinner at the hotel which was okay and overpriced which we found common for other dinners we had in the area. The staff was wonderful and accommodating. Any questions or issues we raised were addressed immediately and to our satisfaction. All in all we felt Le Reve was a wonderful place to stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Retreat”
Reviews.Author: FlowerladyVirginia
Reviews.Content: Le Reve is perfectly located, about 20 minutes north of the city, Playa del Carmen, and about 45 minutes south of Cancun. The resort has only 25 rooms, 5 of which are in bungalow-type structures right on the beach - which are wonderful! There is great attention to detail and personal service. The setting is beautiful, the beach well appointed and very private in feeling. The restaurant serves excellent food. If you are looking for a relaxing escape to a beautiful setting, this is for you. Only two negatives: the sandy beach is beautiful - but the entry to the water is rocky and not very inviting. Walking along the beach a few hundred yards in either direction, however, and there is plenty of easy water access. The other negative is that once you leave the highway to approach the resort, the road is very rough, basically unpaved. Finally, a note: this resort is NOT for familes interested in bringing children...they would be bored to tears. It is for couples seeking a romantic serene escape - and a marvelous choice for that..

Reviews.Title: “Pity”
Reviews.Author: Brank0
Reviews.Content: We booked Le Reve hoping it would be the crown of our Yucatan tour. The site was promising and the rooms looked nice and chic. First of all, the access to the hotel is rather poor. Not only is the road bad, it's also not marked properly (unlike other hotels in the area), so one has no idea which exit to take from the highway. Finding it poses a problem even with local taxi service. The room was indeed lovely, spacious, with simple, clean design, wonderful view and perfect bedlinens (we had the Horizon suite, which is not a suite but a room). Yet, there was not a single chair in it, probably for fear it would clash with the design. So, nowhere to sit, one can just stand or lie. It is unfortunatelly impossible to bathe in the sea, because there are rather large and sharp rocks right in front of the hotel. We had to walk up or down the beach and bathe in front of other hotels, which were clean of rocks and, moreover, protected by a sort of breakwater, nothing we encountered at Le Reve. Having had no car, we dined at the hotel every night. The menu is rather limited, and can easily be exhausted within a week. After the first night I had bad stomach problems, not necessaarily related to the hotel food, but I had nothing else these days. Although the waiters were very kind, they were also pretty inapt. It was only on our last day that we got the breakfast right, although we just ordered the continental breakfast as noted in the menu. One day it was one fruit platter for us to share instead of one each, than no orange juice, we never got brown bread, although we asked for it, etc. And last, but certainly not least, the prices and the billing. Half of the costs was paid in advance. The other half was paid immediatelly upon arrival, which would have been no problem if it weren't charged in pesos, at a very high exchange rate. Naturally, my credit card was debited in dollars, at a regular exchange rate, so that eventually, the total price was 25% higher than expected, what with unexpected taxes and this shady exchange policy. One should think that our holiday was ruined, it was actually rather nice, but without these things it would have been perfect. The cleaning service always did excellent job, the room was spotlessly clean. The other personnel was also always attentive to our needs. I really enjoyed being far from busy Playa del Carmen and it's mass tourism. Yet, one would expect much more from a 5 star hotel sharging 375 dollars per room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Gloriously beautiful with great service and people - we hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: MathewP
Reviews.Content: Le Reve Hotel was truly a gem. My girlfriend and I spent about 4 days there in January and we wouldn't hesitate to return. The staff was friendly and professional and the guys in the restaurant were helpful beyond the call of duty. The weather wasn't great when we were there - it was unusually blustery and cool - but it was still a glorious trip because of the setting, the comfortable rooms and bed and the quiet and privacy of the place. We were sitting in the restaurant drinking coffee trying to stay warm when Freddy draped a cover over my girlfriend's shoulders. It was a really sweet gesture. The food was exceptionally good (and I'm a bit of a food snob from New York) and we ate every meal there except for a couple. The included all you can eat breakfast (get the chilaquiles with chicken and egg) and excellent coffee pretty much held us until dinner (try the delicious ceviche). And if we wanted a snack there was always beachside service. The hotel is beautiful and feels very exclusive, yet it's also homey and casual. And it's very romantic. This was the first trip my girlfriend and I took together and it definitely helped to solidify our relationship. If you walk down the beach a ways you'll find a mega hotel where the beach was as crowded as Coney Island on a Sunday. We were really glad to get back to Le Reve. The beach is gorgeous with soft, white sand but, swimming-wise, there is coral right up to the waterline. Fortunately, they provide water shoes, so if you just walk out a ways that's not a problem. The place was not inexpensive but if you want a romantic trip away from the craziness of Cancun and Playa del Carmen (which is only a ten minute drive), this is the place to go. And we hope to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Sun & People....Cold Drinks”
Reviews.Author: DBinCT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed some vitamin D replenishing and relaxation. At Le Reve we found the hotel to be spotless, the food very good for the value and the service the best. The people are what draw us back to Mexico time and time again and the staff at this hotel was most delightful. The hotel is small in comparison to many others and not alot of action, but that's what we wanted. They did have a bbq on Saturday which was a delight. We met others who were looking for the same serene experience. Now, on nights when we needed a little diversion we went into town. One day we walked by the beach and it took 1.5 hours, but very safe and doable. Needless to say, we only did that once:) The only drawback I'll mention is that the beach directly in front of the hotel is rocky so you do need to walk down a bit. Oh, and the fitness center needs a facelift especially when the name of the hotel includes the word "spa". Other than that, we very much enjoyed out stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little hideout”
Reviews.Author: optrain
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went there for a long weekend and even though it was very short it was the most relaxing trip we ever had. We really wished we could have stayed longer. The location is gorgeous and very private since there are only 25 rooms. We rented one of the bungalows. Those are located almost directly on the beach with a little private whirlpool on their little terrace. At night when you lie in bed you can hear the waves so close and that was incredibly romantic. The food was really good and the staff was very attentive no matter where we were (beach, pool, restaurant...) or what we asked for. Next time we'll stay for more than just a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “The Hidden Gem at the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: trvlr73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking to escape from the city cold and craziness and after reading all the great reviews about this hotel we had very high expectations. We were not disappointed. When we arrived and the ocean stretched in front of us, it felt as if we had landed on a remote island. It's hard to explain, but the hotel is stylish and very personal at the same time. The place also turned out to be ideal for sports (running, swimming, snorkling, etc.) and, most importantly, for relaxing at the beach. The staff was incredibly friendly and the food at the Restaurant was excellent. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible hideaway”
Reviews.Author: elizabethbussian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Le Reve (2/7 - 2/14) and fell in love. The hotel is a little hard to find...but..once you do you know you have found a piece of paradise.... The hotel is an oasis of peace and calm. The rooms are beautiful and invite you to completely relax. We had a suite with a terrace which overlooked the pool and beach. I believe most if not all of the rooms do. The terrace needed an umbrella but really that is all! The beach is a great walking beach in either direction... going south you will find more secluded beachs and coves while north are more of the resorts...either way you come back to your little hideaway. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating...the food was good - although we ate most dinners in town or at the resort restaurants - breakfast and lunch were perfect. We enjoyed an amazing tiki torch dinner for two on the beach which was amazing... ask for the special Maya Margarita and enjoy this incredible escape! The only area that needed help was the gym as the equipment needed to be updated...but we were on vacation and walks on the beach were much more fun anyway!

Reviews.Title: “big flaws”
Reviews.Author: BJaneH
Reviews.Content: You can't actually swim at the beach in front of this beautifully designed hotel because the foreshore is coral and rock. A walk down the beach means a view of chicken wire fences or huge resorts - there are far prettier stretches of beach further south. At such an expensive venue we should not have had to listen to elevator music from the bar or landscaping equipment at 8 a.m. The food is fancy but not very good quality and fairly expensive. And the place is much too hard to find - needs a more visible sign.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: katkit
Reviews.Content: My husband, his brother and I took a quick trip to le Reve to celebrate my birthday. The only thing we regret is that we couldn't spend more time there. From the minute we arrived, we were treated like royalty. Reception was quick, friendly, but casual. We were put at ease immediately even though the weather was windy and rainy. No worry, the next 3 days were perfect and so was our service. The food was above average (we ate every meal there) and the service in the restaurant was six star. Our every request was granted. The beach was beautiful with plenty of lounge chairs, palapas for shade, and food service on the beach. The rooms were good too--not six star, but very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We slept like babies. I hope I don't have to wait until my next birthday to return to le Reve!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, quiet, relaxed, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Norman626
Reviews.Content: So here we are in freezing Colorado,and we need a break. We locate Le Reve on line and decide to go for it. What a magnificent find. The beautiful and appealing design is an airy blend of Mayan and contemporary details which, combined with the small size, create a stunning space in which we felt relaxed and well cared for. Warm, friendly and helpful staff. A beautiful, private place with a lovely infinity pool, beach and caribbean sea. Spacious, attractive and clean rooms, ocean views, great robes and towels, and many thoughtful details. A super complementary breakfast, with fresh fruit, and much, much more. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cestfounon
Reviews.Content: Le Reve Hotel & Spa is hands down the best hotel experience I've had in the US or abroad. My partner (an Italian restaurant owner with extremely high standards) and I were ridiculously impressed with the quality of our stay and the attentiveness of the staff. The food and chef were amazing. We've been hesitant to eat ceviche since we've returned home, because we know it won't compare to any of those on the menu at Le Reve. Also, the staff were incredible. Our every need (including late night cigarette and tequila cravings) and desire was anticipated and met. Our room and the hotel itself were also incredibly beautiful. Minimalistic, but every basic need, including AC, a comfortable and beautiful bed and room, great shower, etc. was met. We will definitely come back to Le Reve, and we highly reccommend this hotel to anyone looking for an escape from reality.

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkPetey
Reviews.Content: When I started looking around for a place to take my wife for our anniversary, I had no idea we'd end up at beachfront hotel, but I'm glad we did. I wanted to take her somewhere small and away from the crowds where we could disconnect and when I saw Le Reve, I was sure this was the place. It's only about 2.5hrs flight from New York, so getting there was fast and easy. We rented a car and drove from the Cancun airport and were greeted with a cool, fruity drink and a view that I thought only existed in the movies. We were whisked away to our cozy room and hit the pool where we were spoiled the rest of the afternoon while watching shoreline and a pair of flirtatious iguanas! We were treated to fresh fruit breakfasts and some excellent meals ('m from New York and have high standards!). I think I ate the best filet mignon I've had outside of the US one night for supper and my wife was addicted to the ceviches. The staff were always looking after us and made sure we had everything we needed. I think the biggest plus is that the hotel is outside of any towns so there are hardly any people on the beach. We went into town one day for a few hours, but after walking the crowded fifth avenue, we were happy to get back to the peacefulness of the hotel. The beach in town was so crowded that we didn't even consider staying there for a swim. There were a few mosquitos, but the staff were pretty good about making sure we had repellant and we saw some people fumigating one day.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Style”
Reviews.Author: JTripperNewYork
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped onto the mohagany deck in the reception to our parting ocean view, Le Reve made our vacation absolutely incredible! The waiters, massage, reception and housekeeping staff were top notch and made sure we had everything we wanted, in some cases even before we asked for it. Their friendly smiles and warm greetings made us feel more than welcome, almost as if the hotel was our home during our stay. The room really blew us away. THE BEST BEDS we have ever slept in and the first (hopefully not the last) time we've falling asleep while listening to the waves on the shoreline outside our door. I think the best part about staying at Le Reve is that there were no crowds. We were really looking for a quiet getaway and this place definately met our expectations. We went into Playa del Carmen one day and couldn't believe how many people there were everywhere! We quickly walked the 5th avenue to pick up some souvenirs and then went back to our quiet beach to soak up the sun and enjoy the special treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hidden hotel, great for couples and just relaxing”
Reviews.Author: go14677
Reviews.Content: I must say that we had a great time at this hotel-spa even though we encountered one major problem: the air conditioning in our suite wasn't working properly. The hotel staff did everything they could to fix the problem and we didn't want to move to another room. Because of this situation, they generously gave me a complimentary massage, which was absolutely amazing. We booked a Garden Suite, and since there was a wedding at the hotel that weekend, they upgraded us to one of the two suites. Beautiful room with a terrace, nice view of the beach, and I loved the high roof. The bathroom is nice and modern, but it could be a little uncomfortable since there is no door in the toilet area and no curtain or shades in the terrace doors, so if you don't take the proper action (like putting a towel on the shower door) everybody in the pool could entertain watching you taking a shower. Besides that, and it wasn't a real concern for us, it is a really nice, ample, simple yet comfortable suite. The hotel staff is very kind and helpful, from the concierge to the really nice restaurant waiters. Overall, the food at the restaurant is fairly good but not vegetarian-friendly. Nice pool and beach area. Took a nice and long walk along the beach and the water was clean and warm. Do not expect big resort amenities. This is a small, cozy, hidden, cabana-like boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A must for those that want complete relaxation and special food”
Reviews.Author: beachismyheaven
Reviews.Content: Okay...I have wanted to book a trip and really didn't want a busy all inclusive. My daughter is celiac and needs a special diet. Contacted the hotel and chef contacted me back within 45 min. Over the next few days he put together a menu just for her and it was more then we expected. ANY ONE THAT NEEDS A SPECIAL DIET..TRY THESE PEOPLE. I can't not say enough and I am picky. It is not a party hotel and is a little far away from the main street but that is what also makes it so nice. My daughter who is 16 did not have one attack so I know that they did everything rite. thank you guys at Le Reve!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LolafromTexas
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay! We stayed in one of their suites. The room was fantastic with plenty of amenities including a spacious well lit bathroom. The food & the service were outstanding. Hats off to the staff! Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from check in to check out”
Reviews.Author: apamexico
Reviews.Content: After a hard work year, I was looking for a great place to rest and relax. I went with friends to Le Reve and found just that. As soon as we set foot at the hotel we were offered a complemenatry drink, and enjoyed from the view to the pool and the sea from the reception. We were then shown to our rooms. I stayed at a very nice bungalow "Paraiso" that is just a few steps away from the beach, with a plunge pool and a deck that makes the room a perfect spot just to enjoy and relax. The staff is friendly and sure know how to pamper guests and do their job, all our needs were catered in a prompt way. The restaurant's ambient is very nice and food is spectacular, the menu is well balanced and I enjoyed absolutely everything I tasted. Le Reve is a great hotel and a perfect place for a romantic getaway. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Vacation or Get Married”
Reviews.Author: nntreeg
Reviews.Content: The first time my (now) wife and I visited Hotel Le Reve was in September 2008 when we were looking for a place to hold our destination wedding. Immediately, we fell in love with the location, friendly team members and their amazing service and, after meeting the owners, we quickly decided it was the perfect place to have our wedding and related events. At that time, the hotel was still fairly new and they had only hosted one wedding at the property. However, over next several months, their popularity grew and changes were made to the staff and some of the hotel policies and procedures. As a result, we encountered some challenges here and there, but after a few conversations with the general manager, staff and even the owners, everything was quickly addressed and ultimately turned out perfectly. The hotel's wedding coordinator, Katherine, was very helpful and nice and assisted us in finalizing the many details of our wedding weekend event. She was organized and proactive and followed- up to ensure things happened smoothly and correctly. As a future bride at the time, that was exactly what my wife wanted/needed from a wedding coordinator - especially because it was a destination wedding for 40 guests. Katherine was indeed a welcomed addition to their already outstanding team. We had our wedding rehearsal dinner at Naay (Le Reve's restaurant) and the courses were beautifully presented and were exceptionally delicious. The chef, Saul, utilized fresh and local/regional ingredients that provided the authenticity we desired. He was very energetic and creative and gladly offered to prepare several dishes that were not a part of the regular menu. That said, the regular menu items were very good as well and we and our guests enjoyed every dish we tried - and we tried them all. The shrimp tacos, fajitas and tirimasu were particular favorites as was a refreshing cocktail we named "Jefecito!" We held our wedding ceremony on the beach in front of the hotel and it felt like a private beach because of the secluded location. The team made sure the grounds were picture perfect and even assisted our vendors in setting everything up for the ceremony. As for the rooms, we stayed in a Bungalow and enjoyed it greatly because of the beautiful ocean view, the plunge pool directly outside and the king sized bed that was unbelievably comfortable. Naturally, the mosquito net certainly did not hurt things either. ALL of our guests loved the hotel, staff, food and the suites and many have still not stopped talking about their experiences at Le Reve. The entire team will do their best to accommodate all requests and to make sure that you receive excellent service.
